jwNR4BZnM9G636pnJTLhKw.text: Had the kale caesar to start and the buttermilk fried chicken (like apparently the majority of customers). The salad was very good and the dressing not too overwhelming. I especially how the made the substitute with kale, as it adds a good satsifying crisp to the taste. They gave a strawberry shorbet between the appetizer and entree as to clean the palette. The buttermilk fried chicken was amazing. I've never had fried chicken at a fine dining establishment and it was a very refreshing experience. I'm from the East Coast so I might not have the most reliable comprehension of what the best fried chicken is but it was ridiculously good. The batter was very smooth and thin. The meat itself was very tender and had a distinct juicy flavor which went perfectly with the light gravy that came with it. I wish I could remember it honestly. Writing this review made me so hungry that I had to stop in the middle to eat something. Anyway, the waitress mentioned how the restaurant is owned by two sisters for a very long time and one of them does all of the baking. Next time I'll have to try the dessert.

dNJBgY7-6lLYk_O24mJbXg.text: They've still got it. Perfect lighting, stellar service, pacing is very carefully done. If you want a meal that feels expensive, but really isn't, try Carpe.  The Grilled Grape salad, our fav from the last time we were here, was different, but delicious. Baby romaine, baby arugula, microgreens all tossed with that magical balsamic reduction, tiny pieces of a salty, stinky blue cheese. Every bite was sublime. I sure can't make a salad like this (and believe me, I try regularly).  Cheese plate is reasonably priced, bordering on a steal, depending on what the daily cheese is. Last night, it was a super mild manchego, which complimented the full-frontal-assault of the brie nicely. Accompaniments and plate architecture were fun, and we totally got into pairings based on placement, which a good cheese plate will lead you to do. Awesome.   Entrees were good (mine) and amazing (the special, his). Eggplant roulade, mine, suffered from mush factor (maybe inclusion of walnuts or pine nuts inside the roll would give us something to bite into?). Flavor was stellar - smoky, bite and acid from the tomato concasse complimented the fresh mozz well, but I kept looking for more cheese. Of course, I always am.   His - mushroom bolognese, was flawless, surprisingly rich and meaty and deeply flavorful. Seriously impressive.  We had a bottle of Chardonnay despite being white wine haters. It was really good, and I kept the cork to try and get a hold of some next time I want a good, light wine.  If I were at the helm, there are two or three changes I'd make, and I'll be so bold as to write them here (hey, that's what Yelp's all about, ya?):  More wines by the glass, or a wine flight. A Chef's tasting menu, complete with wine pairings, taking care to offer a vegetarian-specific menu. Another kind of bread (and butter) to go with the delicious rolls already served.  Even after a (for us) pricey bottle of wine and more food than we could finish, our bill landed at $100 (again). Thanks Carpe! Mi amore.

2BSEdZJ1SSKl1DIDORyHwg.text: A Gem!!! Arts & Crafts architecture, just right lighting... Started out a bit rocky by being seated at a 2 topper table in the doorway - where one diner would be knocked by all who entered and exited  the dining room. We had reservations so expected better.  We requested something else and were initially given a "..big wedding party in the back, all other tables taken..." type of story by the young hostess - with no real satisfaction to us. After we met our server Paige she was oh-so accommodating and suggested we could move to another table in a corner - which may be nosier since it was next to private room with wedding reception - ANYWAY, it all worked out FABULOUSLY. Paige was a dream, professional, personable, and efficient.  Food was fantastic, cocktails were potent and well crafted.   We will most definitely seize the opportunity to dine at CD when we get to Charlotte in the future.  Go there Now - and enjoy!

yEUis4fHEyAOlyJ5GyYQdQ.text: Favorite restaurant of mine, going on nearly 20 years.  Most restaurants "fade" with time, but not Carpe.  Consistently interesting, palate pleasing food served by professional wait staff in an understated quiet ambience conducive to talking to your table mates. Very nice bar and wine selection.  Love to dine there.

BNL2NVKYiVkbdT0kz8bULA.text: An old standby that actually sources their food. Very upscale for the price, friendly service, but most importantly fresh and local cuisine. Always on my go to list!

dqZC9fV5GQhvVd-h0M9W1w.text: I found out about this fine dining spot from a gift certificate I was given. Come dressed in your Sunday best and be prepared for some really good eats. Service was on point from the moment you walk in. My husband and I had dinner reservations so we were immediately seated. It was not crowded and the noise level was overall on the quiet side. I highly recommend getting their Prince Edward Island Steamed Mussels. It comes with ciabatta bread slices that you can dip into the mussel sauce for an extra treat. So much flavor and just the right amount to share where it won't get you full to enjoy your main entree. For dinner I had the Seared Sea Scallops and my husband ordered their Grouper special. Both dressed and plated French cuisine-style (small portions) so at first you're thinking, OMG this is it for so much $$$?! But we were both SO FULL, it was actually plenty to eat. To end the meal we chose the coconut cake with pineapple mango gelato which had a little kick of spice. The cake alone was incredible but paired with the gelato, DYNAMITE. Will definitely be ordering a full size of this cake with gelato for upcoming big parties we will host. This spot is perfect for a date or an intimate celebration.

ND3NEgk-ESKeSFGGPsOvCA.text: I've been looking forward to trying out Carpe Diem for quite some time, finally getting the chance over the weekend with a group of friends. You'll definitely want to be sure to dress up a bit as the decor and vibe is fancy, but although the crowd was a bit older, it wasn't stuffy. On to the food....  We ordered the calamari appetizer, which was honestly so-so, but it started looking up very quickly after that. The warm rolls and soft butter they bring to the table was very good in combination with the goat cheese salad. The apricot jalapeno vinaigrette dressing was delicious and the three fried goatcheese balls with hazelnut crust were out of this world. You NEED to get this salad if you like goat cheese.   For my main course I had the scallops, which were cooked to perfection. The portion is small (only three per order), but worked for me after the huge salad, bread, and calamari that I'd already eaten. We just had to try dessert, and the peach/raspberry cobbler with ice cream was just the ticket to round off a great dining experience.   The service was very good, and the fare a bit pricey, but as a "special occasion" restaurant, this would make my short list. Parking on a Saturday night was a bit tough, but with the other restaurants on that street, it wasn't surprising. And I would definitely recommend making a reservation. Enjoy!

-JBUDRAstkh21tsDUi38bg.text: Ate here for dinner a few weeks ago and every part of the meal was fantastic. Great bread and salads. Both the fried chicken entree and the seared tuna small plate/app were excellent. Great balance of flavors and textures in tuna dish. Will definitely be back.

RbTL1McOA8_mkOpaq-rImg.text: Had Valentines Day dinner here. The food was great. I had the grape salad first which was pretty simple but tasty. For my entree I had the filet of beef. It was delicious with a buttery cheese on top. Unfortunately, I wasn't too happy with my desert. I had the chocolate cake and it tasted kind of dry. But luckily I got to try the deconstructed coconut cake which was AMAZING!!! And the fried apple pie which was also good but the coconut was my favorite.

F-sdrNOOINqIz829m_m6lw.text: Went here last night with my parents and while the whole meal was delicious, the blueberry cobbler was definitely my favorite part. I don't even like blueberries and I would eat that morning, noon and night if I could.

zahr2E7pM2HWtFWorqBmQA.text: The food is to die for. The decor seriously lets down the food. If the place was a little cooler there would probably be a week long wait to get a reservation.

johFFe7f-Gm8pQiCWhu68Q.text: Went here for restaurant week and enjoyed the 9 oz pork while my date had the Salmon.   Both plates were prepared deliciously and the hot rolls they bring you are just delicious.   The service was as expected of a higher end joint and the tables were cleared immediately after courses were completed.   I was very satisfied with my experience here.

r8QaBxCJfJqP0ok28zdfQQ.text: I had dinner at Carpe Diem with a good friend on a recent Tuesday evening.  The company was excellent, but the dining experience wasn't something I am eager to repeat...    First, the atmosphere.  Others have commented on this already, but I really didn't care for the decor or the atmosphere.  The lighting doesn't really work - the restaurant is too bright - and the furniture and flooring just really aren't up to snuff for a restaurant that's going to charge these kinds of prices.  Truth be told, the place reminds me a lot of a funeral parlor... Yeah, I know.  For an appetizer we ordered a salad - priced over $9 - and we told them that we were going to share it.  They split the salad, served it on two plates, and charged us a $2.50 "split plate fee".  You're kidding, right?  The salad was good, but not even close to being worth the nearly $12 that they ended up charging us for it.  My friend ordered the Mediterranean sampler from the appetizer menu, and she enjoyed her food - and I am at least glad for that.  My entree, the scallops served with risotto, was fine but overpriced.  For $24 I received three scallops on a bed of risotto.  The risotto was undercooked.  The flavor was fine, but for $24 the risotto should be better than average - especially when there are only three scallops.    To me, this is quintessential "high end" Charlotte dining - decent food that is absurdly priced.  If they had charged $8 for our salads and $18 for my entree... it would have been a reasonable value.  For what Carpe Diem charged, though, I just found myself wishing that I had gone somewhere else.

LxCo8h2eePjjFDq0g-6SCA.text: I had dinner here on Saturday night, and I was very pleased by the experience. It didn't hurt that this was a company dinner, so it was free, but I would've like Carpe Diem regardless. Very comfortable, quiet restaurant that oozes niceness without being overly fancy or ornate, which is a nice balance.   There's a nice bar in there, not too big, that serves up great pre-dinner cocktails/wine offerings. But it's the food that really had me raving. Great appetizers all around, and even better entrees. Try the grilled grape salad--it was amazing. I had the Mahi Mahi, and it was perfectly done. I also sampled the grilled steak, which was pretty darn good, too. Desserts were also extremely well-done. Again, everything was pretty pricy, but the quality merited that.   I'll definitely be back--even if I have to pay.

eISaJcCvDYN-ycnqai4P8w.text: I think there is a lot better food to be had in Charlotte.   This place definitely has a romantic vibe going; its just that the food is not that good. Wasn't memorable, exciting or impressive.   Would pass up in favor of something better.

QCYmebDXk3b1XuTzujAstg.text: Excellent food! Great Service (EXTREMELY important to me) The amosphere is very nice the decor is beautiful. My wife and I along with another couple went and had an excellent time. Our server was very knowledgable about the menu items and various selections. We will definitely visit again

uVvDcDPi_cnJWgvqLUHvKw.text: What a wonderful experience. Atmosphere is tasteful and extremely comfortable with a slightly modern Tuscan feel. The service professional yet warm and genuine, with none of the pretense I hate. The food was origional, and absolutely delicious! We challenged the bartender to create an after dinner cocktail and received an amazing chocolate raspberry concoction that beat the band and wrapped a perfect experience. Well done! Truly Charlotte's finest.

I70nQ2YE_xXkKuqVhtAeJg.text: We are from Ohio.  I first made a reservation here back in October when I was looking for a nice place to have our anniversary dinner.  It did not disappoint.  Everything was wonderful.  From the moment we walked in the door and were greeted by the hostess, then we moved to the bar to have a drink before dinner and had a very nice conversation with the bartender.  When we were seated at our table we were greeted by a very friendly busboy who filled our water glasses and asked how we were.  Finally the service was outstanding.  Since we are both from up north we had never had grits, so our server brought us out a sample to try and they were excellent.  We both ordered the specials.  Being a vegetarian I was impressed, not only with the selections on the menu, but they also had a vegetarian special.  Everything was amazing.  It was a wonderful evening.  We just recently went back in February and it was just as good the second time around as the first.  Everyone is so friendly and professional and the food is out of this world.  I would highly, highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a nice, quiet place to have a delicious meal.

1_tgDH63iTZIA53nzD7fhg.text: A wonderful cosy atmosphere with my daughters on Wednesday night. The staff were amazing and very friendly. Service was excellent and the food was delicious. This restaurant has lived up to its reputation and we cannot wait to come back.  We shared the Indian Lentil Dip and Kabob Plate at the bar with a delicious New Zealand Wine. The Peppadew Peppers, which originally come from South Africa were a great addition to this dish!  We moved to the very comfortable and elegant Dining Room where the food experience only got better! Warm Goat Cheese Salad, Vege Cake and The Scallops, were the perfect choices for the evening!  Thank You Carpe Diem for the delicious food and the awesome dining experience.

LYQxaCBBOxw_qy_OSZlYFw.text: Carpe Diem catered our wedding for us this past April (I'm a little late on the review...). We wanted half Indian and half Southern cuisine.  Although they had never done the Indian cuisine before, it was fantastic!  In fact, all of the food was fantastic (including the several desserts they provided for us!).  Bonnie was always extremely professional, on top of everything and we never had to stress about how the catering would turn out.  We still have wedding guests raving about the food at our wedding.  I would highly recommend them for any event you need catered, you will receive the best service and quality food.

_KLyrqqfSr5Pi8XbgwDvNQ.text: Want to take your special date to a posh dinner? Dress fancy and get ready for a dining experience at Carpe Diem.   I had to take Todd W's advice...goat cheese salad! The food was delicious! We ordered the cheese plate to start. It was proportioned well and the cream, the hard cheese, paired with the fruit and honey were just right. For the main entree, I ordered the vegetarian couscous and hubs got the veggie special of the day. Both were made fresh to order and I savored each bite. It was so good that even as full as I had become, I couldn't stop eating until it was almost gone. The wine list had plenty to choose from to make a nice pairing with your entrees as well.   They try to source what they can from local farms and they make a menu to reflect what is fresh for the season.  I love having a 2-hour dinner without feeling rushed; it makes me feel high class. The server was very nice and attentive, giving us time to enjoy the experience.  Save your Benjamin's and when you're ready to splurge treat yourself to a night at Carpe Diem!

mYQltUouQ-N9WebukQuuQQ.text: I cannot believe this place exists! How is it competitive in Charlotte? The flavors are absurdly overdone: super salty, super sweet, and conflicting in that they pair savory with super sweet and drown it all out. I may have an answer: the place is filled with the elderly. Maybe it's "The Walking Dead" tongues. Seriously, the youngest person there was in their early 50's. It's like a "speak-easy" for the rich elderly...it just keeps afloat by a secret handshake that acknowledges you are in a terrible place but you can be old there without the riff-raff. Also, it is terribly expensive for the low quality they are putting on the plate. Even the drinks are super sweet. AVOID AT ALL COSTS!

8YKK_PjIWOj27-jOyoXYIw.text: Food was great & service was excellent!!  The coconut pineapple cake is the best dessert I've ever eaten!! I also thought the acoustics were great - we could hear each other speak without yelling, which seems to be a luxury lately. They changed to plate set for my cobia without any grief which was appreciated!!

IyZ34XlghMtLNM2coxleOA.text: This is quite possibly the best new American restaurant in Charlotte. The service was great and food was exceptional. I had the strawberry salad and trout main. The strawberry salad was very well executed with sorghum popcorn, radishes, ricotta and balsamic. The trout was a very large portion of fish, fresh vegetables and pea puree. My husband got the duck confit which was a pretty amazing near replication of chicken and waffles... VERY FLAVORFUL. Better than the Fig Tree, McNinch House, 5Church... The list goes on. You should probably eat here.

Sn--l9o6VNCI0K8X4PIZKw.text: This place is on point.  Ate at the bar with a friend, bartenders were fun and skilled.  The cappuccino martini was sooooo good!  Ordered the cheese plate, with some amazing candied cashews and spreads.  The duck confit was out of this world!  Green beans with some sort of crunchiness mixed in...yum.  I need to come back with a small group and try the dining area, but if it's anything like the bar experience this place is a gem!

M8gMGguP7wCiu9ykKYC_uw.text: Came here for dinner and were overall impressed with both the food and service. Started with the cheese plate which was great, and the wine list was decent as well. We ordered a variety of entrees, and the only memorable issue was the fried chicken came out a little colder than expected. Will be coming back here again.

Bv_wr7xrNFkRjZESMqnscg.text: Had dinner during Restaurant Week.  The grape salad was wonderful - generous serving for an appetizer.  I got the hangar steak with blue cheese dressing.  I ordered it medium - it was more medium-rare.  I didn't send it back because it already had the dressing on it - was worried about what would come back.  For dessert, I got the chocolate crepes.  They were good - but I enjoyed my friend's dessert more - cherry cobbler with vanilla ice cream.  YUM.   I also enjoyed the 1/3 off all drinks!

M9o-uYu2fpmd7Y8w_AogOw.text: Truly a meh experience for the #1 rated restaurant in Charlotte per TripAdvisor (I cant imagine that is accurate).  Decor is pretty nice, service was good, got a table easily on a Saturday night (hmmm).  The food was good, not terrible, not great.  We split the chopped salad with gorgonzola.  I had a pasta dish (tagliatelli maybe), that was fine, but kinda bland.  I dunno - just not that great and I won't go back.   "Over-rated" clap-clap clap-clap-clap.

b6vy2vGK1Ojup2f89Gn89g.text: Great meal and the service was excellent. I had the steak which was outstanding. Try the meatball app it was fantastic. Perfect restaurant for business or pleasure

o8NHcWQViU4gYw9dXZeoEA.text: Three words; get the chicken. Insanely good, and worth every penny. Our server told us that there have been Facebook groups in tribute to this chicken. A True five star experience from start to finish. I cannot wait to go back!

pYnRVI8OLs-S4UkAfUe1JQ.text: We went here for my girlfriend's Mom's law school graduation and had a great time.  We almost unanimously chose the fried chicken for our entrees and everyone was blown away. The only person in our party who didn't order the chicken ordered the pork, which was a really great twist on pork chops and apple sauce. Our appetizers and salads were excellent too.   One of the cooler things was that the staff knew about the occasion and had celebratory confetti on our table waiting for us when we arrived.  The staff was really friendly and helpful as well.   All in all a great experience and a restaurant that I would recommend to anyone in Charlotte.

MP7NfJ2z5BLMtNBqA3icWg.text: We went on a Saturday night April 8, 2017 after many highly recommended the restaurant they said there were options for our dietary needs just state in the reservation. We did this and the only option was tasty but smaller than a sample. Although we had reservations the table was not ready because there were 2 large parties that we were sandwiched in between. Those two parties demanded all the servers attention therefore inadvertently diminishing our attention. Maybe this is the best this city has to offer but my hopes were high due to all the recommendations but for $20.00 a plate I would like dinner not a sample. I rated this restaurant a 3 meaning it was ok. Will I return? Possibly. Will I recommend this place? Not at this time.

R9-QsRZNIPXR12H_RwjPsg.text: The service was great! The lady that waited on us, was on her A game. The food left a lot to be desired. The Mushroom Bolanase with Oyster Mushrooms, plain and boring. The Taglatel pasta was clumpy, and sauce didn't penetrate the center of the clump. You couldn't taste the mushrooms in the sauce. It was a dish that got your hopes up, and left you hanging. The last time I was there I had the fried Chicken with mashed potatoes and gravy, and Asparagus. The chicken was flat tasting, and had very little seasoning in the crust. It was extremely crunchy, well cooked, and moist in the center. You could get better fried chicken at Bojangles, and for a lot less money. The potatoes were real potatoes, but at least a day old, and cold in the middle. The asparagus was cooked to perfection, but untrimmed. We would hate to put the staff out, by asking the to prep the asparagus. I am a chef and would die before, I would let these dishes out of my kitchen. When the plate goes out, you should have pride in your work and put your best efforts forward. The margins in this restaurant are fat, and the quality should reflect that. Don't break your neck to get there. This is a good place for a great restaurant, to bad hasn't happened.

bA9vKxC1EnelpeB03Rhx9Q.text: We came here on a Saturday evening for a dinner date. A bit dressy here so I'd recommend looking nice. The service is impeccable- the waiters were always checking in on us. The food was good- I had the mushroom bolognese with shrimp with a side of sauteed spinach. For dessert I had the Creme brulee which was delicious. All in all, I recommend to try it out.

kY94ww5J91LK1NCc_ZGuZw.text: I'm somewhat surprised by all of the rave reviews, because this place was just OK. Admittedly, I'm from out of town and my hometown has more foodie culture, but I still feel like Carpe Diem leaves a lot to be desired. The service may have been the biggest disappointment, as while they were friendly they were inattentive. I think we only saw our waitress 3 times during the meal (once to order, once or twice during the meal, and then to bring the check). We weren't offered refills on our beverages, which was a bit frustrating. We had to find another server (not our assigned server) to refill my BF's beer and I was never offered more than one glass of wine. The food itself was mediocre. Not bad, but not great. The flavors weren't well balanced, so dishes became quite one dimensional. For example my BF ordered the pork chop and the accompanying risotto overwhelmingly tasted of garlic (and I love garlic, but this was a bit much). Likewise, the shrimp and grits were over powered by the jalapeno bacon, which left me underwhelmed. On the bright side, the shrimp seemed fresh and didn't have a fishy flavor. The carpaccio was terrible, in my opinion. If you like mustard, you would probably love the carpaccio, but again it was too strong in the dish. While I like all of the aforementioned flavors, I don't like them so strong that I can't appreciate other flavors within the dish, which was my primary issue with Carpe Diem. The atmosphere was fine, but perhaps not as high-end as they think. Overall it's an OK place to go for an easy dinner, but I wouldn't go for a special occasion or date night. Maybe I'm a snob? With so many other restaurants in the area I don't think we'll be back, because there must be something better out there.

vAnNPTR_H-Nbkm9hb3kjpA.text: We sat the bar area and had an unforgettable dining experience!! The fried chicken....oh my. It was the best fried chicken I have ever had (and I'm from the south!) Beef carpaccio was delicious. Drinks were excellent. We liked the bar as it was not too stuffy. Can't wait to go back!

5_SXxzb0l1a3r82EWpSyFw.text: I'm not one to dish out five stars for just any restaurant, but Carpe Diem is definitely deserving.  The fella and I made reservations for a Saturday at 6:45 and stopped by an hour early to have a pre-dinner drink at the bar.  We walked in and were promptly greeted by the hostess and manager.  We grabbed a seat at the semi-circular bar; the fella ordered his usual dirty martini with Tito's Vodka, and I had a specialty cocktail that I can't remember the name of, but it was like a gin and tonic with cucumber, which made it even more refreshing.  Our bartender was engaging without being omnipresent, and after about 20 minutes, more people started to filter into the bar area, which was cozy - there were not only stools at the bar, but also comfy looking loveseats and chairs around the perimeter - and almost had a Tuscan feel.  After our drink, we moved into the dining room and got the best seat in the house!  There's one table in almost a cubby hole with curtains that I guess you could close if you wanted, and it's an awesome seat.  Even more awesome was the food.  We got the beef carpaccio to start ($10), and I loved the mustard and capers gave it just enough tang without being too spicy, and the ciabatta bread was a perfect accompaniment.  For dinner, I got the pork tenderloin ($25) with fried plantains - the entire reason I got the dish - and BBQ baked Sea Island peas.  Now, I hate regular peas, but these had some sweet onions mixed in, and I ate every bite of food on my plate.  The fella got the Scottish salmon ($25), and he said it plus the scallion-ginger relish on top was pretty darn delicious.  We checked out the dessert menu, but we were too stuffed to try anything.  Also, our waitress was very nice and down to earth and came over the perfect amount of times to check on us without being annoying.  So, not only was the food amazing, but the atmosphere is also right up my alley - it's good food without being too snooty.  We, like a lot of other customers, were in nice jeans, but it certainly didn't feel like it was fancy.  If you wanted to dress up, that'd be fine, and if you wanted to be a little more casual, that'd be fine, too.  We can't wait to go back.

wwYkJjRSao45wcl78tK6cQ.text: Carpe Diem was fantastic! The ambiance, service, & food were all great. Together, our group enjoyed house cocktails, a bottle of merlot, the featured soup, the vegetarian feature, the duck confit, the trout, and the smoked pineapple & coconut cake. This is a great place for a special occasion.

Nnjm8_J4anT5KMkYdP5F3g.text: I really wanted to like this place and had high hopes, but ended up disappointed.  While the service was spot on and the cocktails and wine selection were excellent, everything else lacked.   We arrived around 6 pm and the restaurant was far from busy.  While our server was excellent, explained the specials and took our orders very efficiently, the wait for our food was something else.  Kitchen management needs improving as our order took forever.  Several tables that were seated after us were on dessert while we were still waiting for our main courses.  To be fair, we were a larger party (9), but with the restaurant being so slow there should not have been such a long wait.   However, I am ok waiting if what I get in the end is worth it.  Unfortunately it wasn't.  While our entrees were not "bad", they were nothing exceptional either.  Just ok.  Scallops were probably the best of all and the hanger steak was cooked perfectly and paired well with the sauce.  Again, nothing wrong with the food, just expected more.  The atmosphere is nice - especially the bar.  Will consider returning for cocktails and appetizers, but doubt we will give dinner a try again.

1qrw8haMLFkavaE8LAiJJg.text: Great dinner experience here with a close friend and Charlotte resident!  She had previously heard good things about the establishment and wanted to try it out, so we did.  The atmosphere is classy and chic.  Began the meal with cocktails, which were good but on the weaker side.  Our waitress recited what seemed to be 15 different specials for the evening, and new every detail of each--down to sauces and ingredients. I was quite impressed! For the main course I ordered the Duck Confit, and it was tender and fell right off the bone.  Overall a good dining experience!

0jIVLvwzY29wrkJropaivw.text: I don't live in NC and that made it harder for me to choose a best fine dining place for my bff's bday dinner. After some internet research I chose Carpe Diem and made a reservation. Overall we had a good experience, nice time with couple fails on their part..  Best: We both liked the ambience the place - lived up to their name "carpe diem" (which means be in the present - the ambience definitely helped us to enjoy the present moment). Since we had a reservation and I had mentioned on the phone that its for birthday, they went an extra mile and decorated our table with little birthday sparkles. That was very nice of them, to make ma bday buddy feel special :) Food was good, nothing extravagant to rave about, the food presentation was very nice! We got a salad, cheese plate, I ordered pasta from the special menu and my friend got Scottish salmon. Everything tasted good and fresh!   Service was good and prompt but they can definitely do better. I agree with one of the reviews here - Prior to the entrees, we were served a cleansing sorbet which tasted good.  However, the server never bothered to tell us anything about it and why we are being served something we didn't order - she just set them down in front of us - not explaining what it was/the flavor/or anything.   Could be better: It was a birthday dinner and I wanted to order a surprise dessert so I stood up making a restroom excuse to find our server and order dessert. When I didn't see the server anywhere in the dining area, assumed she was inside the kitchen, I went to the receptionist, placed my order and told him it was a surprise. He assured me that he will pass on the order and make sure our server knows it's a surprise. This was a big bummer - the server comes after 5-6 min and asks us for desert order :( unwantedly I had to tell her that I placed an order with the receptionist, next thing I see is she comes with the desert with happy birthday written on the plate and a bday candle I had requested; but she gets it right to me and says happy birthday. This was very disappointing. I was like Really? You think I will go and place a surprise desert order for myself? Poor communication between staff.. The dessert was delicious although Service  could have been better.

U2e-lgOF92Zhb2JajsIWvg.text: I took my boyfriend to Carpe Diem for his birthday dinner. It was overall a great experience. I had the duck confit, and he had the filet of beef. I wasn't a big fan of the pumpkin waffles (the pumpkin flavor was a bit too strong for me, but the waffle itself was amazing), and he didn't like the blue cheese on his beef, or the sauce on the side. But we did enjoy our entrees nonetheless. The dessert was okay, it actually disappointed me a bit. He had the Mexican chocolate cake and I had the chocolate torte. The chocolate was just so strong and there wasn't enough other flavors for me to balance it--this might be a nice dessert for chocolate lovers.   They also decorated our table with Happy Birthday confetti, which was a nice touch. There was an awkward moment when I was eating bread while waiting for our dessert, and our server took the bread away while I was in the middle of holding a piece, chewing it. My boyfriend said, "Excuse me, she's not done with that," while the server was about to leave the table. She put it back and apologized... was it not obvious that I was still eating it??

DKyTA97P_Gp4DaIZjArzfg.text: Waitstaff was super friendly and always around to refill our waters or to clear our plates. The fried chicken and mash potatoes were really good. Good portion size. Reasonable priced beers for a fine dining restaurant.

8-ot7-NGpn_zlUg9NXP-ww.text: I had my birthday dinner here a few years ago. There were about 8 of us. The staff was extremely accommodating. The atmosphere is classy, without being pretentious. Based on the crowd and the decor,  I imagine this place would be great for happy hour too.     The food was good. I had the scallops, which were pretty standard. But a few people let me sample their entrees. The pork chop and the fried chicken were very good.  This is a great place to celebrate a special occasion.

photos.caption: Photo of Carpe Diem Restaurant & Caterers - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mexican hot chocolate cake with ice cream
Photo of Carpe Diem Restaurant & Caterers - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and Israeli Cous Cous
Photo of Carpe Diem Restaurant & Caterers - Charlotte, NC, United States. Featured appetizer: Oyster Rockefeller

NxcdBtv7_jDjLbRvzBdnBQ.text: Awesome! Didn't know what to expect because I'm not from here and I'm super picky! Loved loved loved the special. Wagyu hangar steak on farro that was just so delicious!! All three of us ordered it. Michael, our server, was great!

XGCq-iaMxZl-J0VKFDIeNg.text: Fabulous food and service! Lamb meatballs were superb, shared 3 of the specials. Appreciated the wine selection. Decor very conducive to enjoying a special meal.

wLnSr00q3gWoL9BVypFMOA.text: We took our three kids ages 7, 5, and 2 for 3 days in January 2017.  We like rustic, and this place was perfect.  Sleeping accommodations were great and fun.  The kids loved the mosquito nets.  Food is totally organic and homemade here.  Breakfast was amazing.  We made cheese from scratch, starting with milking a cow.  We swam in waterfalls and jumped off rocks, hiked, visited an organic coffee farm....Kobe the owner is top notch....thank you....please support this paradise....go here!!!

bBL9eecb8FYSApwTXvFJWg.text: Had the salad special, the duck and the souther julip.  Bartender was really good.  They do not have draft beer, but they do offer craft beer in bottles and cans.  The salad special was really tasty; all ingredients were super fresh and complemented each other very well.  The duck was good, but the portion/slices were too big/thick for my tastes after having the salad and bread, but that's probably more specific to me than others.  My compatriots had the scallops which looked amazing.  Service was fine.  I kind of wish I had ordered the chicken instead, as I've heard amazing things about it, but I couldn't see how that baby would fit with everything else I'd consumed that day.  It looked GOOD from what I saw at other people's table's though!

AQqamegqUsTg2MOWeVePuA.text: I can't think of anything negative to say about Carpe Diem.  The food and service were fantastic, and the owner came by to speak to my wife and I and was very, very gracious.  The menu's a little pricey, but it's worth it, especially for special occasions.

HrQ5vEw-Q04D-O1HrvFI2g.text: Last week, we had dinner here for the first time. It was honestly one of the best meals I've had in a long time. We started with the butterscotch glazed duck wings, which were melt-in-your-mouth good. I had the shrimp and grits. They were divine, better than any I've had in Charleston. My partner had the fried chicken. It's a huge, crispy portion and he enjoyed it. I kept stealing bites and agree that it was good. The gravy was rich and peppery, super good. We finished with creme brulee and the peanut butter chocolate cake. My creme brulee had a thin consistency, but was tasty. His cake was superb. We'll be back!

2k_hlcD4HbAH1334tb14hQ.text: I'm not familiar with that part of town, so was a little disoriented upon arrival about where I could park (once I left the restaurant though, I noticed the huge lot across the street). Suggest perhaps you mention that on your website as I tried to do a little investigation before I left and didn't see anything.  Otherwise it was an amazing experience.  From a perfectly made cocktail to start with, to great service and great food, I enjoyed it all.  The atmosphere was beautiful and warm.  I admittedly am a little sensitive to having servers try to whisk my plate away when I lay my fork down. I am dining, and take a break occasionally to enjoy the company I am with and savor my meal. But, it was a minor distraction.  I look forward to returning and trying more menu items.

ntRgtiZXICcSf7W1wET18w.text: We were visiting charlotte for a few days and had dinner here with some friends.  We started with the ahi tuna appetizer which was perfectly cooked.  I had the salmon with asparagus dinner and my husband had the fried chicken with mashed potatoes.  Both were delicious.  We ended the evening with the chocolate torte which was amazing.   Normally I would take a bite or two, but I could have eaten the entire dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Carpe Diem Restaurant & Caterers - Charlotte, NC, United States. Seared scallops
Photo of Carpe Diem Restaurant & Caterers - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried chicken with mashed potatoed
Photo of Carpe Diem Restaurant & Caterers - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon

YCUxwwlBL9x7iF5Mb6Y5MQ.text: Took a client team our to dinner. The food was good especially the octopus. but the service was quite subpar. The restaurant was half-empty and I was very surprised with that waitress definitely was not paying attention.

VJ5lvBP-wM5pmWqXnvqCMg.text: We ordered the duck and the pork chop. We ordered the pork chop medium temp and it came out well done. It was hard to slice and super tough. We didn't see the waiter until I was done with the meal and he decided to check on us. The duck was delicious. The waffles and duck were so well seasoned. Service was awful. The waiter complained to us 3 times about how he had "sooo many tables sat at once". Sorry, but I've been a waiter and that's a pet peeve of mine. Im paying you for a service, I don't want to hear how I am an inconvenience to you. Will NOT be back.

uwb2DYz4WvK4-e-5gpPWsw.text: I made a reservation online though open table, something I thought we might need as it was restaurant week, although we weren't going for restaurant week.   My husband wanted to treat me to a date night, and had been raving over their fried chicken for almost a year when we decided we would go.   After looking at the restaurant week menu, we thought we would just go with the entree because I'm not into salads, and we knew we would be too full for dessert.   The waitress brought out warm bread before we ordered, but the food came out so quickly we weren't able to finish the bread.   We both ordered the fried chicken with yukon gold mashed potatoes, black pepper gravy, and spinach. Not really being a big fan of spinach I asked for mine on the side. Surprisingly I did eat some of it when it came out, it was actually pretty good. For my taste I would have liked more salt, but they only have pepper on the table.   The fried chicken is boneless, a huge plus in my book. The gravy is also white gravy, and not brown gravy, which is also another plus. The mashed potatoes were great, some lumps but more smooth, perfect.   Overall we had a great time. Once we sat down at our table we were out in 45 minutes, super fast, great service.   **Just a note we had reservations for 5:30 but wanted to have a drink at the bar beforehand. They only open at 5, so we didn't have much time to sit. If ordering a drink, best to go with something simple like a liquor plus a mixer. Keeps the price down.

photos.caption: Photo of Carpe Diem Restaurant & Caterers - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bulldozer Martini

lrxCQUpyq09KnxRtQMKMLg.text: Living in the Chantilly area, this is a family favorite. More often than not, we carry out, but we've also dined in a number of times.   Carpe Diem is located on the amazing strip in Elizabeth, along with Customshop, Passion 8, Viva Chicken and Earl's grocery to name a few. The restaurant is quite large with a large bar area up front that is great to get a drink or have a more casual dinner. The dining room is nice and quite formal though you can easily get away with nice jeans and a collared shirt.   The menu is fantastic. We've never had anything we don't like. A few favorites...fried chicken and scallops. In my opinion, this is the best fried chicken in Charlotte. Amazing crust, very tender and juicy. It is served with mashed potatoes and a pepper gravy. The scallops are my wife's favorite. Tender, always great texture (important with scallops).

kxIMgI6VrNJSi0dyN11BdQ.text: S'wonderful, s'mahvelous.    What a wonderful evening in a beautiful restaurant with delicious food!  The other reviews about the romantic atmosphere are spot on - the exposed wood, low lighting, gorgeous light fixtures, white table clothes, comfy chairs, artwork... everything is just perfection.    We had an early reservation that on a dreary January Tuesday evening wasn't really necessary, but it's always nice to have the option - I would imagine that on date nights, this establishment is packed.  We were able to easily park in one of the two large lots for Elizabeth Ave businesses.  Be mindful of the tracks that run down the street, cracking your ass in front of a first date could be catastrophic (or a good story for later).    Fresh, warm bread and butter (plentiful butter, instead of one tablespoon that people have to fight for) were brought to the table.  Our waitress explained the specials of the evening in detail and gave us time to look at the menu and decide.  I opted for the fried (boneless) chicken breast and Yukon Gold mashed potatoes, sauteed spinach with shallot-black pepper gravy.  My serving was two smaller chicken breasts that were fried perfectly, not greasy at all, and were very tender/juicy.  The mashed potatoes were buttery delicious and the sauteed spinach was seasoned just right.  The portion and flavors were spot on!  For dessert I had the cherry cobbler which was served with vanilla ice cream.  Again - perfect.  Buttery cobbler with just-tart-enough cherries, and just enough ice cream and whipped cream to complement the dish, but not dairy it down.    From the moment we walked in the door, I could tell it was going to be a wonderful evening.  The host was friendly and helpful (asking if we were celebrating any kind of occasion), the waitress and staff were attentive without hovering and the food was one of the best meals that I have had recently.    Queen's Feast 2015 is starting soon - I would definitely put Carpe Diem on the list as a stop!

PUMqk4sap40b24BHkETG0A.text: One of my favorites! The buttermilk chicken and grilled grape salad are outstanding. the bulldozer martini is great.  Great value for the money.

photos.caption: Photo of Carpe Diem Restaurant & Caterers - Charlotte, NC, United States. Buttermilk chicken!

kBAjzAQ25NBF-tDrx2_uUA.text: Beautiful interior, excellent service, divine food.  That is all that I really need to say.  However, there are mentionable aspects that set this restaurant apart from others. Carpe Diem is the quintessential date night restaurant.  It features romantic lighting, a carved ceiling and large paintings of flowers.  What could be sexier than that?   We had reservations and were seated immediately.  There were several nice wine selections by the glass, and, although they were pricey, they gave you a darn good pour.  In fact, one glass each took us through dinner. We were brought the most delicious bread with butter.  I rarely eat bread, but when I sampled theirs, I ate one and a half pieces.  Bad girl! I was pleased to see that they featured Anson Mills products on their menu.  And, even more delighted with the offerings of vegetarian and vegan selections. They even had a vegetarian special for the night.  How thoughtful! I did  order that vegetarian special.  It was a tart with a whole grain crust, covered with tomatoes, asparagus, cheese and a perfectly cooked over easy egg.  Phenomenal!  My date ordered the Anson Mills rice grits dish that featured their sea island red peas and Gouda cheese.  He chose the mushroom option instead of the shrimp.  Again, a stellar dish.   A five star rating seems skimpy with this kind of quality.  I rate them an entire solar system!

opFJK1oT5LY4-gS94Nw3KA.text: Favorite restaurant in Charlotte, hands down. Solid, consistent and great.   Great atmosphere, service and food. Since days on Tryon St., Carpe sets a major standard for excellent dining in town.  Cheers!!

qa_JQc5qlM9PUc9TtK4NAg.text: We used Carpe Diem to cater our wedding, and it they were nothing short of outstanding.  Bonnie is amazing to work with - she is unbelievably creative with her cooking, and really helped us to get the exact experience we wanted.  Our guests all raved about how great the food was, which was really important to us as foodies.  Every time we've come here as diners, the experience is just as good.  The only time it wasn't to the nine's was during restaurant week, when (like most establishments) they are extremely rushed.    Definitely give this place a try, it's 100% worth it.

aWZPEzUC65RnkGO0iRPH-w.text: This fine restaurant deserves 5 stars if for no other reason than the hands-down most artistic and romantic ambiance in the entire Metrolina region.  Seriously, I feel like I'm sitting in Bilbo Baggins' hobbit hole with all the bowed wood and twisted iron.  The wine rack behind the bar looks like a many-branched oak tree.  The bar and dining room just call for a most-intimate dinner.  Luckily, the food is just as quality as the environment.  Little galvanized metallic boxes hold fresh-baked rolls for the table.  The many-seeded variety are best- tasty and a good mix of crunch crust with a softer inside.  For a salad course, I'm a big big fan of the grilled grape.  The micro-greens are always garden-fresh and when you get a grape, they each have just a hint of smoke taste that blends nicely with the blue cheese but is a unique surprise.  The goat cheese salad is also very good, but still in second place, in this Yelper's humble opinion.  Between the salads and the entree, we've always had a small intermezzo course of fresh sorbet.  The flavor changes, but is a great palette cleanser regardless.    Entrees run the gamut from a couple fresh fishes, pork chop, and a (very tasty) buttermilk pan fried chicken.  The selection is well manicured so that just about anyone can find an option.  The even make a point to have at least one vegetarian entree option every night.  Even the vegetables that accompany the protein are artfully done.  Foodies will appreciate the detail that goes not only into each of these dish's components, but the way the flavors and matched together.  I'm even a raving fan of their desserts.  These can change regularly, but you can count on at least one chocolate option and a cheesecake.  Everything is made from scratch and the portions are perfect for sharing.  The staff works in a team approach, though your server is leading the effort.  Courses and delivery are expertly paced and everyone is very knowledgable about the menu and the bar.  I always feel very well taken care of.  We can never seem to leave here for under $50 a person, with a drink or two, but I never mind, the quality of the food and the service are on a plane above most of what you'll find around town.

v0BFBWR9-a_ItaE2uKqT8g.text: We mentioned Yelp but did not get 10% off our ticket.  Our waitress had never heard of Yelp.  Anyhoo, dined at 7 pm on a Thurs. Evening- got right in, no reservations.  Casual elegance- pretty wooden arches and lighting- sat by a large window.  Not too stuffy- we were fine in jeans.  Soft music in background allows conversion to flow without shouting.  Family next to us dined with their happy,loudly talkative baby and no one minded her.  :).   We had our 10 year old daughter and 6 yo son with us. Everyone scarfed down the delish bread and butter.  Jack had fried chicken tenders and mashed potatoes- best any of us ever tasted!  Bella had shells with white sauce and real Parmesan on top- it was good, but the Parmesan is NOT from a bottle like it is at home, and she was not fond of it.  I suggest getting it on the side just in case your kids might agree w/her.  I got the goat cheese salad because it was so praised, only to discover I am not fond of warm balls of goat cheese.  I guess I am a cold goat cheese gal.  My hubby liked it, though.  The waitress was very attentive.  I tried To convince her my salad was okay, but upon her further questioning, I fessed up and said I wasn't a huge fan of it.  My hubby loved his Salmon, even though it looked to be a small piece, he felt satisfied with it.  I got the veggie plate for my meal-  way too tangy for me, due to the glazes on them.  Told the busboy I was finished with almost a full plate left.  He tipped off the manager, who was concerned that I wasn't happy, and she offered me something else, but I was full on bread, salad, and sampling the kids' meals, so I declined.  She took BOTH off our bill, even though I had eaten all the salad, because I said I wasn't crazy about it.  We did share two desserts amongst the 4 of us.  The peanut butter pie was dense and rich, but not overly peanut-buttery.  My son doesn't like peanut butter but loved it!  Chocolate crepes were delish- homemade ice cream melts quickly though, so eat fast!  The ice cream was the best I've ever had.  I would definitely return and get fried chicken or another entree next time- the service and atmosphere are great!

photos.caption: Photo of Carpe Diem Restaurant & Caterers - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chocolate crepes filled w/homemade ice cream
Photo of Carpe Diem Restaurant & Caterers - Charlotte, NC, United States. Peanut butter pie w/Oreo crust

rwVBebubets5V6iu7MbWxQ.text: This might be my new favorite restaurant in Charlotte. Tried it for the first time tonight. Absolutely outstanding!  Dinner started with the farmstead salad. Now, I'm not a big salad guy.  I usually nibble just to kill some time, but not this time.  This salad could have been my meal. It was delicious.   For an entree I went with the pork chop.  Probably the best I ever had!  Juicy, tender and delicious.  My wife had the chicken dish, which I think is their specialty.  I took a taste and could see why.  I'm drooling just thinking back on it.  Again, juicy and delicious.   Carpe Diem is a little pricey, but well worth it when you want a nice dinner.  The service was outstanding, and the place has a great atmosphere.

OGtqr17fmC1a1VLG5jia0Q.text: Excellent spot in great area! The Food was very good and the prices were moderate. Service was good as well. Try to Fried Chicken Breast entree, delicious. Hanger Steak left a little to be desired though, but overall good choice. I would recommend.

i6ZbJb9rpAkN7geQaR8A_A.text: We received a BoGo coupon in the mail and tested this place out. We walked in and were surprised by how quiet and welcoming the atmosphere was. I ordered the Buttermilk Chicken Breast dinner and the meal was fantastic. One of the best chicken recipes I've had. Everything tasted like it was made from scratch.  I have no complaints and would certainly visit this restaurant again.

pQLCF49nI1Lfoxt2srijrg.text: Always a favorite and consistent in the quality of food, service and ambience.   However I think some sort of dress cold should be enforced.  Last night bevirevthen dinner we had drinks in the bar and paid $ 14 for a martini but sat next to someone in a tank top !!!   Not appropriate attire for a resturant of this caliber and price point !!

20u3ibkvcHzptrr-50I_zg.text: It'd only been~15 years since I last ate there - how dare they move? Twice? Graduation night dinner for #1 child - great intimate late supper with her and my the mother unit. Food was great, our server was gluten sensitive which really made ordering easy; look, I had wine and I don't remember much except for the fact that the food was tasty, the two ladies raved, and we didn't get sick. Minus a quarter star (thus retaining the 5 stars) for the dessert (a cocoanut cupcake with cream cheese frosting). Our server couldn't vouch for it (since it was glutinous) and I should've trusted her. It was okay, but didn't stand up to the rest of the meal. Oh wait - I remember that I had scallops and they were the cat's meow! Great ambiance; beautiful digs in a part of town that's apparently been fixed up since we lived there and well trained staff. Oh this pic: media3.ct.yelpcdn.com/ph... happened to be in the Men's Room; it's a picture of the restaurant from when I last went to it (right next to the First Union building where I worked).

3ATxlE7eOOMFsDIxgBu4UA.text: Great service and a nice but relaxed space.  The food was creative and interesting.  I tried the salmon special, which was cooked to melt-in-your-mouth perfection.  It's fairly pricey, but I would recommend giving it a shot for a nice occasion.

z4Lo6ClzwA6eZdTWtRq2dg.text: Carpe Diem is such an elegant place to dine.  Their modern, yet neutral toned decor appeals to all.  Small details such as ceiling molding that curves and allows light to sift through, just adds another touch of class.  The light fixtures that pop out of the wall like bunches of flowers are gorgeous.  Just my style!  So ambiance gets an A+.  Now on to service...  Service - excellent.  Our waiter was attentive to all of our needs.  There were three of us in attendance.  We each relied on him for wine recommendations and they were superb and reasonably priced.  He was able to share all of the specials without having to recite from any cards.  He responded well to our many questions regarding the menu.    Food - just perfect.  We ordered calamari and a seared tuna appetizer plate.  They were just out of this world.  The different unique but flavorful dijon based side sauce for the calamari was perfect.  Tuna was amazing.  The garnishes allowed you to make your own little test experiments.  Mmmm!  For dinner I ordered the "Eggplant Roulade."  It was delicious.  It does have a smokey flavor to the sauce which I was initially hesitant about.  After trying it, I did like it.  Overall, I enjoyed my selection.  Next time, I will try the Cous Cous.  The waiter gave it very high marks.  I will definitely be visiting Carpe Diem again!

MZj22HVSYZQVduvxXVkz3w.text: Hostess was prompt at stand, got seated right at our reserved time. Bussers/server assistants were on point with bread and water but that is where you lost me. Server was hard to understand and extremely soft spoken, we could barely understand the specials. She was quite unaccommodating and simply not present. We went strait to entrees seeing that the restaurant had filled, thinking it would save time. I ordered the filet w mashed and my significant other, the pork tenderloin. When the food came out the presentation was beautiful but once we took a dive it was a different story. My filet requested medium came out mooing unseasoned. I sent it back to have corrected of course. Now being that I served tables in fine dining establishments throughout my twenties I expected a manager to run out the corrected entree and make sure it was right before leaving with an apology. The server brought back my steak practically tossed it back at me and run off, continuing to present an unwelcoming and distasteful impression. Now again the filet was unseasoned and still at best mid rare. I told her 10 minutes later when she finally showed her face again, to simply take my place I wanted no more of their dreadful cooking. Asked for a check right away thinking our anger would advise her to have management certainly come by to speak with us but again, and much to no surprise this time she came back with a check. We paid and left with no apology, explanation or condolence. Safe to say we wont return, and advise others to simply spend their money dining at an establishment that prides themselves in ensuring proper service and hospitality with results. With there being so many delicious options in the Elizabeth area, its no wonder I have never heard of you. To end, we felt invisible and ill-advised.

t4aWnr8l2K9CTo6pnxCTPQ.text: One of my top 5 restaurant spots in Charlotte. I've been here several times and have used a restaurant week on more than one occasion to indulge. The scallops are fantastic when they're served with almond risotto. I've also had the steak which comes with a great sauce and potatoes and asparagus. Buttermilk chicken is my new favorite. Menu is seasonal and changes so that makes it interesting each time I go. Always have to start with the goat cheese salad...so good with tons of flavor!   If you're in the mood for more than one restaurant in one night. Start at Customshop next door for drinks and an app and go here for dinner.

-SaJJxY9_VlNDFlY6ytZbA.text: Seize the day and get your hungry self over to Carpe Diem. While Carpe Diem is a little fancy pants to just roll into with jorts and a Dale Jr. tee, make the effort. It's a lovely restaurant- beautifully appointed and as Julia S points out - stellar service and impeccable pacing.   I've taken many of visiting family members here and I've never had anything less than an extraordinary meal. It's not a cheap meal, but it's well priced for the quality and quantity. For two of us with a few courses and a bottle of mid-price wine we usually spend about $120-$150 (including tip). Some of my favorites...  Warm Goat Cheese (salad): I mean, really, it's warm goat cheese over delicious greens with hazelnut crunch. It's so good you basically want to start fist pumping through the restaurant.  Cheese Plate: A very generous and tantalizing plate of cheese of the day. As Julia said - the accompaniments make it stellar.   Scallops: I've had them so many different ways here I can't even count. One time they had some vanilla essence another atop of risotto. Both times they were out of this world. Cooked and seasoned perfectly. Plus they give you a very generous portion of large scallops. YUM.  Desserts: They special make their desserts daily and I wish I could remember what I've had here. I know I've had some delicious type of creme brulee and something uber chocolately. Regardless, I don't think anyone would be disappointed with their dessert selection!

pIj6JSm5ymfxzBxKt7DfqA.text: OMG. Service impeccable.  The food and drinks were spectacular. My husband enjoyed the fried buttermilk  chicken dish ( he said to die for). I had the special -pink snapper, with red risotto, topped with mushroom salad and  crab stuffed zucchini flower (a first). The tastes blended perfectly. The  dirty martini was well made, and the salad with fried goat cheese was very nice! I liked the touches like sorbet between appetizers to clear the palate and the little giraffe holding olives on my martini glass. We'll definitely return and highly recommend.

H7MN2JOMcQNaEbtSJfrWOA.text: I came here with a large group and we had amazing service! Great food too

gPvFuB_btZbDGy1npeR5wQ.text: This place is awesome! The food is delicious and beautifully plated. Great wine list and seasonly selections. Staff is very pleasant and know the menu very well. My wife and I will be back.

ZzjBMQH6aWHDlr6HMmvQEQ.text: went here while in town visiting family. I had the meza plate with hummus, pita, falafel, and veggies. the hummus was good, the pita had some strange spice mixture..it was slightly sweet, and the falafel was unlike any falafel I had ever had. it had a really weirs flavor to it. overall pretty disappointing.

zWfUBSIKry5wixWPO0YPuQ.text: Just visited my favorite place in charlotte for restaurant week an always carpe diem never disappoints.  The buttermilk fried chicken with yukon mashed potatoes, spinach and a saw mill black pepper gravy to melt in your mouth was to die for.  I cant forget the goat cheese salad with the lightly toasted goat cheese medallions and I didnt do the apricot jalapeno dressing, I wanted the blue cheese vinaigrette was mouth watering.  For desert I had the Oero chocolate mousse the chocolate was wonderful the oreo crust was fabulous, cant wait to go back, i see they have mon-Thur 1/2 price apps from 5-630 i'm gonna try that one evening. Try carpe  diem I promise you'll go at least once in a while :)

zos--ZX6VD1yZRUsdGAvEA.text: I'm still wildly impressed with this restaurant.  They just can't seem to disappoint me they not only serve some of the best food in town but the people that work there truly make you feel welcome and I love that!.  After trying to decide where to take my guests out to eat Saturday night I decided I had to take them to Carpe Diem I just didn't want to try a new restaurant and risk being disappointed. Everything we ordered was perfect, a cheese plate to start with, and I went with the  $23 filet mignon special that was out of this world.  There are so many options on the menu to please any vegetarian or carnivore.  Just one more reason I love this place.

lqJapJRGXemfeOROS0VNZQ.text: Carpe Diem is always wonderful. Fabulous wines, beautifully prepared dishes, attentive but unobtrusive service. A long-time favorite of this longtime Charlottean.

q78xHX3Wx2SYPMdFNQgxHw.text: Wow what a fun night!! We had the scallops and duck confit and both were unbelievable. It was pricy but we went all out with a bottle of wine, carpaccio, main course, coconut cake, and after dinner espressos with baileys. Great ambiance and amazing food. Go here!

photos.caption: Photo of Carpe Diem Restaurant & Caterers - Charlotte, NC, United States. Duck confit. Their play on chicken and waffles. Omg it was good! Flash fried kale and maple syrup. This dish was sweet but balanced.
Photo of Carpe Diem Restaurant & Caterers - Charlotte, NC, United States. Perfectly seared scallops with a light and slightly sweet parsnip purée and roasted Brussel sprouts. Yum!

w2rv0dlpSDn_UQxTs285qw.text: Food was excellent,  We had a group of eight from work and ordered tuna & squid appetizers that were excellent.  I ordered shrimp and grits (as well as a few others in my group) and we all raved about the flavor as well as the quality of the grits (not sitting with a pool butter/oil).  Others had Arctic Char, scallops and the filet....all gave a thumbs up.  The group ordered desserts and went crazy over the coconut cake,  Atmosphere was great and the service also met expectations,  Great place....would definitely come back again with a group or take my lovely bride on a date night.

Qry6kxvgcnT7Tilkb1om1w.text: Great spot! Monday and Tuesday has half off bottles of wine. Yes, please. They also have a great happy hour for half price apps as long as you're there for an early dinner. We accidentally stumbled upon both of these and couldn't have left more pleased. Everything we ordered was tasty and fresh. Beef carpaccio, muscles, cauliflower pizza, strawberry salad etc. These were all apps so we treated them like tapas, which was a great call. Allowed us to experiment more without getting too full. Bar tender was our waitress (at a table in the bar area) and she was really down to Earth and helpful. She helped with recommendations and was attentive while she was multitasking. Overall great food, great service, great price, beautiful ambiance, what more do you need?

-rD7DvTozwD-jSB3FN7FDg.text: I like this place. Wonderful ambience, friendly staff, and great food. Think this is better than the fig tree which I had been two twice.

JmzR2D1_hcxITMHBAZmV2Q.text: A special evening with an old friend we were visiting was made even better by our dining experience here. Our table was ready on time, our server Sara was terrific and efficient and the food and drink were fabulous. We lingered and really enjoyed it and felt welcome and well-tended. Got great desserts to go - also top notch. Bonuses were being seated in the quieter bar area, the owner visiting our table and other staff members working seamlessly with our server for an overall memorable experience. We'll demand to eat there again when we next visit Charlotte.

NrCcHoTcz4vremWFJbi3sQ.text: So many words/phrases come to mind when I think of Carpe Diem like A Charlotte Classic, Best restaurant atmosphere, best splurge restaurant, beautiful decor, exceptional staff, 5 star!, absolutely fabulous flavors and so many more.  The dinner group celebrated it's 3rd anniversary here tonight.  We gathered in the bar area until the majority of our group arrived.  I was in a wine drinking mood tonight but couldn't decide on which red.  The server said I could taste anything and gave me a few recommendations.  I am not normally picky on red wines but I was tonight.  No problem here!  They let me sample 4 wines until I found the right one.    The food menu is small but the items they have on it, they absolutely excel at.  Some of the favorites at our table were the warm goat cheese salad, the scallops and the salmon.  I had the the latter and it was recommended to me by our server.  The salmon was so tender it melted in my mouth.  It was served on a bed of "forbidden rice" which is a black rice that is considered the finest around.  It also came in a light sauce which was quite delicious.  For dessert, I went with the pear apple cake which came with a black pepper ice cream which sounded so intriguing.  The ice cream did not disappoint.  It was slightly sweet with a pepper kick.  Very imaginative!  The cake was moist and flavorful but I didn't really care for the icing.  The service was exceptional.  The staff was constantly checking on us, taking plates and glasses, refilling drinks, giving recommendations.    Also, the decor in here is simply stunning with wood beams and metal across the ceiling and decorative lighting that fits well.  But the most stunning thing is the bar area.  The wine rack behind the bar actually looks like a tree with the wine bottles stuffed in the branches.  I wish I had taken a picture of this.    Besides the icing, the only other flaw I found was that for parties of 6 or more, tip is included in the bill.  If you pay with a card, they write in the tip amount for you and total.  Some people may think this is a great idea but it also prevents you from adding an additional tip in the event you had exceptional service.     Still, Carpe Diem is worth the 5 star rating and then some.

OHw46YqUpZ7qNA3rnRV11g.text: I had been wanting to try this place out since I first got to Charlotte so when I saw they were participating in restaurant week I made a reservation right away ($30 for a 3 courses). We came here last Saturday night with our friend Paul who had never been here before either.   While RW can sometimes take away from the experience certain restaurants would typically provide, it's a great opportunity to see what the restaurant might be all about without walking out of there with a $200 tab. What it really comes down to at a place like Carpe Diem, $30 would typically get you just an entree. So you can look at it however you would like, but pretty much just tell myself that I get a free appetizer and desert with my meal.  All 3 of us participated in the 3 for $30 - However, since they were offer their full menu as well, we started our meal by sharing the seared rare tuna as well as the steamed mussels. Both were VERY good.   I then had the potato soup. It had a little bit of truffle oil and what they call "duck bacon". Paul and I both agreed that there is only one type of bacon in this world and it comes from animal that goes "oink oink" haha. With that said, the soup was tasty and of course I inhaled the entire thing. I then had the pork chop - I would have to say this this was just average. However the mashed dumpling squash that came with it was very very good. It might have been the highlight of the entire entree. I had a bite of the hanger steak as well as the fried chicken and those were both delicious. Of the 3 entrees that came out I would say the pork chop came in last place.   For dessert I had the coffee creme brulee. For my liking, the top was a little over cooked/torched - I really had to press down to break it with my spoon - but I didn't mind it. The custard was delicious so it kind of makes up for it.  Since meeting Paul, he's been really teaching us a whole lot when it come to wine. There's a reason why he's the "wine guy". He's picked up on the types that we like and brought a GREAT bottle of wine to dinner for all of us to enjoy (THANKS PAUL!!) Overall, I had a great evening and I got to enjoy CD with GREAT COMPANY.   I can't wait to come back and try this place again!

VXd-DV8kjliDK_U97OIQsg.text: Beautiful!  Romantic!  GREAT Service!  Fantastic FOOD!  Impress a Date or Client!  Funny, I have Never taken a Date here yet!  So it is a nice place to take a MaleFriend and have a quiet Dinner!  Not as Pricey as you would think for the Total Experience!  Beef is usually what I want here and I have tasted many of the other dishes my Friends have ordered... Entrees are Meals (not a la carte) and a VALUE for the Quality! Potato (dish) many different ones, sometimes a Potato Pasta... One time we got here so early (5:00 PM) the Chef had not decided what he was going to do and let us decide... (Thin Cut Fries... YES!!!) this is a Funny place to order Fries I know and though they were good, I would rather the Chef use his Ideas, Imagination, Recipes or the internet over mine!  Salad Dressings are so good it is hard to choose! I have enjoyed them ALL!  Food here is Better than Del Frisco's (I will NOT be reviewing Del Frisco's) I have eaten at both in the Same Week!  The Sauces here are better than "The Palm"!  Value, Service and Desserts Here is better than Both!!!

oCGqFCCVyu7TfF7wX6hhHg.text: An absolute delight.   We were immediately seated and Mike, our server, was phenomenal. The ambience was perfect for our one year anniversary. Romantic with excellent food and drinks. We ate the filet which was rich and cooked to an exquisite medium rare. We requested goat cheese instead of blue cheese and the chef was more than accommodating. We ended the meal with the Mexican Hot Chocolate cake and coffee ice cream.   The food was remarkable and we will certainly return.

eKqwY7vXoj2Fa2bjXsLqtQ.text: Went here midweek with work mates to celebrate a successful first big meeting.  I was hoping for a place with great food and a fun and modern ambiance.  Unfortunately we found it to be a bit of a miss.  When we walked in the restaurant decor seems dated, or perhaps just generic.  The tables were oddly oriented in the room and despite there being space elsewhere in the restaurant we were seated directly in front of the swinging door to the kitchen. Then there was the food.  The goat cheese salad was overdressed and somewhat soggy; the kale caesar and beet salad were marginally better.  I had the venison as a main which was average and oversalted; others had the friend chicken which was not at all crispy and so was a big disappointment.  We didn't order dessert because we were disappointed in the meal and weren't really up for another round.

aAi8hj0c4AMOOtkHLnC_jw.text: Unless,  you're a vegetarian,  don't get the grits... it's a bit bland. However, the fried chicken got great reviews.  I'll come back to try that.... stay posted.

P8qKpWY5Wr7SpPwlxLbkrg.text: I've never been to Charlotte. We decided to eat at this place based on Yelp reviews. Absolutely amazing food. I had the mushroom pasta. Excellent.

KQKsNk7hl1RTYe4e1dXFCw.text: The mister and I came here as part of Queen's Feast, which can always be a dicey time to give an accurate review of a restaurant. However, I think a solid 4 stars is quite spot on. Here's why:  I was pleasantly surprised with the large portion sizes because many restaurants tend to skimp for these kind of events. I had the kale salad and the mister had the goat cheese salad to start. Both were delicious and entree-sized portions. I appreciated the gelato as a palate cleanser between the first and second courses. We also sampled the pork chop and the shrimp and grits, which appeared to be regular items on their menu. The pork chop was massive, and the squash puree was a nice complement. I love creme brulee, so the dessert was the star of my meal.   I also had the Southern Julep cocktail with my meal, but after having lived in Kentucky for several years, I can't sing the praises of a julep without the mint leaves, so that missed the mark for me. The mint was supposed to be infused according to the menu, but it seemed to have zero mint flavor to me.   As as an aside from the food, many other reviews noted the ambiance, but truthfully, I wasn't digging it. For a Friday evening at dinner time, the restaurant was surprisingly quiet for being busy, and I wouldn't necessarily describe it as having low, romantic lighting either. The crowd seemed generally older, so maybe a great place to take parental visitors.

BHwhFZXNj0FkEYfkCynDSA.text: Full disclosure my meal was paid by a dinner talk so I suppose you would classify this as a catered dinner to a large group. The servers seemed uptight but it seems to have stemmed from the management. Appetizers were bland. Mini crab cakes that were mostly filler and the cocktail shrimp were not all deveined. I order the fish entree to stick to the lighter side. Hours later I am so patched and feel like I will be up all night drinking water because the dish was so salty I couldn't finish it. A few folks overestimate the buttermilk chicken, which looked delicious, however I am unable to eat that due to dietary restrictions. The creme brulee was okay. Nothing to right home about. If I had paid for the dinner I would have been extremely unhappy. The waiters would not even box our desserts or meals to go which I thought was extremely odd. I will not be back here as a paying customer. I really don't see at this price point, how the food is worth it.

iQJCTumXffCd7nimZs4RUw.text: Went here for Restaurant Week with my friends Marco and Allyson. With all the rave reviews, I had high expectations, and Carpe Diem delivered!  The first thing you notice is the decor. A LOT of work has been put into making Elizabeth Avenue Charlotte's premier dining destination, and it really looks great! The trolley will FINALLY provide service this summer after a decade of work, and I'm sure the business owners can't wait to finally get that trolley up and running. The interior of Carpe Diem is very beautiful, with dim lights but not "dark" (don't need to use your smartphone camera light to read the menus....yeay!). Lots of wood all around and a very romantic atmosphere.  Since we all chose the Restaurant Week menu, we of course were limited to that selection. However, we couldn't resist ordering a couple of things off their "regular" menu, and we got the Seared Tuna and Mussels Apps, The Mussels had a cilantro white wine broth that was delicious. The tuna was cooked perfectly with that nice sear with sesame seeds on top. So off to a good start!  I started off with a potato soup with truffle oil. Now if you know me, I order anything that's got the word "truffle" in it and it was a solid effort. I would have liked a bit more truffle oil as I think they put just a couple of drops so I really couldn't taste too much truffle. Allyson got the salad with goat cheese and THAT was quite tasty as the goat cheese was lightly coated and flash fried. Love chevre!  They then surprised us with an Intermezzo sorbet with Thyme to cleanse our palates. Nice touch.  Next up was the Hangar Steak with crumbled blue cheese and creamed kale. I asked our waitress to bring it however the Chef recommends, and she asked if Medium Rare was good. I said yes! But it came out more "rare" than medium, but it was still tasty. I'm not a huge blue cheese lover, but the older I get the more adventurous my taste buds become so I now order things I never used to. While good, it still confirms that blue cheese is not my favorite. The creamed kale was average, and this also confirms that I do not like the hard, chewy texture of kale.  My buddy Marco got the pork chop and Allyson got the fried chicken. After tasting both, I thought Allyson's chicken was the best thing on the table. It was juicy on the inside and crispy on the outside. In comparison, this chicken was better than the famed Leroy Fox's. The pork chop was good but not mind blowing.  The piece de resistance was the dessert! I got the Chocolate Crepes with caramel sauce and creme angliese. OMG were these things DELICIOUS! They were filled with a chocolate mousse or creme...no matter, it was EFFEN GOOD! Marco got the coffee flavored creme brulee and that also was quite delicious!  Because my friends were kind enough to invite me to this special meal, I brought a great Napa Merlot (their fave, not mine) from Nickel and Nickel. I figure IF I'm to endure a Merlot, might as well bring a top notch one, and it paired nicely with our food! Their corkage fee was only $15 which I find very reasonable for such a top end place.  So thanks to Marco and Allyson for making a generous invite. We've all become good friends in such a short period of time....remarkable how FOOD can bond people, even though I'm more than 20 years older than them.  And thanks to Carpe Diem for delivering another really good restaurant week experience! I look forward to going back!

l8zqvgvZs8pcJJ9zTkSIdw.text: Ordered a $52 bottle of wine which was on sale for half, got the warm goat cheese salad which was pure joy, ordered the pork tenderloin with the egg on top and it was awesome. Ordered the coconut pie for dessert, amazing. So the meal was so great I took several clients the next night. I made everyone get the warm goat cheese salad, which was a hit, I ordered the venison which was awesome but I got a side of mashed potatoes which filled me up, don't think I would have got full without it! Lots of filet mignon was ordered. And someone got the fried chicken which was great I heard. I definitely recommend to bring parties here over the same old restaurants!!
