zaOtcKJFc3OfYKkDx_VKAA.text: Recently took my fiance here for our anniversary. She is always skeptical about spending the money for a nice meal, but this changed her mind completely. She had a kale salad with grilled chicken and was blown away. I told them about the occasion when I made the reservation, and when we arrived they had put confetti on the table which was a nice touch, and the server immediately congratulated is upon greeting, little things like that go a long way with me.  I had the grilled quail with a butternut squash puree, and for dessert we shared a toffee cheesecake. This was one of the best meals I've had in recent memory, and after a couple glasses of wine, two entrees, dessert, and tip, the bill was only about 80 dollars, and I promise it was worth every penny. Will DEFINITELY be returning here

I63EQ7Goe7kPiKR1FXxzEQ.text: Fine dining at its best.  Superb service and food.  If you are looking for a place to celebrate a special occasion this is the perfect place.  The service is outstanding and the food is always spot on.  By far my favorite special occasion dining location.   The filet is outstanding and they have an excellent wine list.

xnc9MGAN-q6D-tqfghGGsg.text: Once again we were not disappointed.  We went to Easter Brunch.  They had two courses for 30 dollars.  My husband and I both got the fried chicken with potato waffles.  Absolutely scrumptious.  We had left and brought home two pieces of fried chicken for my husband's Monday's lunch.  My husband chose the fresh fruit for his first course  and I had a delightful salad with goat cheese for mine.  We were too full to have a dessert but the waiter sent with us 2 delicious cupcakes that we devoured later.  You can't beat the fried chicken here.  Great place.

KAIU9SxHzNsgEjamrNZ0wA.text: I had the Cajun pork chop that was delicious and juicy. Palette cleanser was phenomenal.

Ik1XPAnOHl2xsMFjn7aEWA.text: My BFF gave me a gift card to Carpe Diem for my birthday, knowing I had never been there. Thus, I have been super excited to use that gift card.  Friday evening we made a reservation at Carpe Diem. Parking is on-site and it is located near Passion 8, Earle's Grocery, Viva Chicken, etc in Elizabeth.   I ordered a glass of Zinfandel, which was delicious and my husband got a beer. They had a decent wine by bottle selection. The also brought out warm bread to start, which was super tasty!  We started with the Meze Plate that definitely didn't disappoint. Beef kabobs (amazingly tender), olives, zuchinni fritters (these things were perfection!), Naan, hummus, and artichokes. It was like a cheese plate or charcuterie board but ten million times better!  For dinner we got the buttermilk chicken and the scallops. I would have never ordered fried chicken at a nice restaurant but I decided to take the suggestion of fellow yelpers. This was easily the best food of the evening. The chicken was perfectly buttery. Loved the mashed potatoes with it. Large portion. The scallops were fantastic. Large bay scallops and the puree underneath was delicious.   For dinner we got the peanut butter cake to end an excellent evening. Great service and incredible meal!

SZz2CALd-kjZpocIaipNNA.text: Solid service. Good food. Fair prices. Comfortable ambiance. I'm looking forward to trying more on the menu!

VWLpSx8FTLnvJUDDpmtkqw.text: My fiance and I have been wanting to try this restaurant for a long time. He surprised me with a birthday dinner and very excited to try their fried chicken, named Charlotte's best friend. We ordered the fried chicken and the pork chop. Both amazingly delicious! Definitely very happy! Overall rate. The waiters even went above and beyond with birthday confetti waiting at our table!

lSrRZkQvjVe3rJ5-2CZ0JQ.text: Salty salmon soup(ish) meal for restaurant week was not so good. The salad and cheesecake was great but could have done without the salty salmon soup.

1ioDmnSxpOr0W1q4EQmcWg.text: We are at this restaurant for my girlfriends birthday. We had a reservation and were running late and they accommodated us. They were aware of the occasion and had a small separate table for two prepared with birthday confetti on the table. Our server was friendly without being overbearing. We started with the fried oysters and they were awesome. I had the pork chop and my girlfriend got the scallops. Both were good and nice portion sizes. The bread and butter tasted fresh. There was a strawberry peach palate cleanser which was refreshing. Nice location. Great restaurant.

gT-5nojb77B7xvd2GGdFYQ.text: I've heard a great deal of hype about Carpe Diem, and I confess, it is warranted. Great family-owned restaurant and great experience all around.  It is clear that this restaurant does well, and has many regulars who attend. The food and service was top notch. You never have to worry about having an empty water glass, or even bread bowl. They will refill your bread bowl infinite times (huge plus). I thought the bread was decent - could have been seasoned more (I say this despite the fact I ate 3 pieces).   They have an extensive cocktail list - all between $10 and $12. They don't offer a huge selection of wines by the glass; probably 4-5 glass options of red and white. You're better off ordering a bottle.   I came in set on ordering the fried chicken because that is what people rave about and it's been on their menu for 20+ years. I was mentally prepared to not even look at other options. However, I then glanced at the menu and saw the duck confit option over pumpkin waffles that couldn't be ignored - so we were set on that. And then, I was just craving some scallops.   The crispy fried duck confit leg should be your go to choice. It comes over two triangle pumpkin waffles with maple butter, atop crispy kale. I don't know how, but somehow the kale works in this dish, and works well. The crispy duck is amazing fall off the bone. It was so tender and flavorful. I had to just take a few bites off the duck confit itself to savor the flavor. I don't mean to undermine the scallops in this review. They were still very delicious - atop a medium sized crunchy piece of pancetta, a handful of brussel sprouts and parsnip puree. SO GOOD!! But the duck confit wins in originality, creativity and all around awesomeness.  we didn't get dessert this time - maybe next time. I'll be back, Carpe Diem!

Photo of Carpe Diem Restaurant & Caterers - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Carpe Diem Restaurant & Caterers - Charlotte, NC, United States

ubpbxSui82B4xtRCzKsrRg.text: 4.5 stars, rounded up for excellent service.  Lovely restaurant owned by two sisters for the last 20-something years in the Elizabeth area.  Their menu is what adrove me to bookmark this spot and eventually try it out today, finally!  A short Uber ride later, we arrived to an almost-empty restaurant on a Tuesday evening, which eventually became more filled as the evening went on.  The crowd seemed like the business crew, since I recognized all the finance and tech speak that was going around at all the tables.  Our server was extremely friendly, patient, and helpful.  She always kept coming back to check on us - gotta love that Southern hospitality!  We started off with 3 appetizers: - Grilled octopus - probably one of the smallest pieces of grilled octopus in the form of an appetizer I've ever seen.  However, it was of a good texture and cooked fairly well, though it could have been slightly more tender. - Beef carpaccio - I would not recommend this if you are not a mustard fan.  It's covered in a tangy, slightly spicy mustard.  The beef itself is sliced so thin that you hardly taste anything except the mustard - probably the only downside of this dish. - Mussels - the broth is flavorful and different from the typical white wine and garlic both and the crostini that came with it was amazing.  However, I just wasn't all that impressed by the mussels - they could have been infused with more flavor from the broth and the texture of the mussels were way softer than I am used to - they basically fell apart when I tried to take them out of the shell. Overall, I'd have to say the apps were a 3-4 star quality in my personal opinion.  For my entree, I chose the venison, cooked medium rare and loved it.  Everything about this dish was good, from the well-seasoned, perfectly cooked venison to the very flavorful kale and pancetta.  This dish is quite a bit tangy what with the wine/grape sauce, but I love tangy food so this was great for me.  We went a little wild on dessert and ordered three.  The toasted coconut cake with ice cream was nothing short of amazing and was my favorite item of the desserts.  It was a very moist cake with cream cheese frosting and not too sweet.  It was also HUGE.  It went very well with the spicy pineapple and cold ice cream.  YUM.  I would definitely go there and get just this again.  The creme brulee was pretty standard - it had a great vanilla bean flavor to it.  Unfortunately, I didn't try the shortbread cookie.  The mexican hot chocolate cake was just too chocolately and rich for me, and thus I did not have much.  Definitely, definitely go for the coconut cake when you're there.  5 stars for this.  Great experience here - would recommend to business travelers and tourists to CLT!

jJl_h5Iqsn4Z-PdQvDJiVw.text: Found this spot on OpenTable and decided to give it a try.  I was not aware going in, but the chicken is a specialty and apparently has its own Facebook page.  Get it .. you will not be disappointed! Flavor is great, portion size is ample and it's just tasty!  Ali had house salad which was full of flavor as well.  Scallops were other specialty they recommended, but I opted for the bird ... menu has great variety so everyone can find something.  Prices are very reasonable and you don't leave feeling  guilty for blowing a bunch of money on a meal.

gyGatdUMko9ljDmGgc_mGQ.text: I recently had a Christmas company luncheon and to my surprise Carpe Diem catered. I've always wanted to try Carpe Diem but never got the chance and was a little afraid to have a catered service as my first experience. To my surprise, the food and the serving staff were brilliant! I loved the chicken that was served, it had a great spinach alfredo stuffing. The pasta shells and meatballs were also delicious. The sides consisted of garlic bread and assorted steamed veggies, the veggies could have been seasoned better. The side salad was tossed well with a good amount of dressing and had a great crunch. All in all, they rocked the savory dishes. The dessert consisted of lemon curd bars and blueberry crumble squares, they were a little sweet for my taste.   But, the servers that came with the catered service made the experience ten times better! I was so impressed with how nice and attentive they were for a small catered luncheon. Thanks for the great experience, this will definitely bring me in for a regular sit down service.

dDrRJQ7Itak3pUSsRCjFnA.text: The food and lovely service definitely make this restaurant a place to go for a special occasion or celebration. Every dish has great flavor and presentation, so you can tell that the chefs care about the food that goes out. The atmosphere is great for a big party, family, and a special occasion like a mentioned above but it is also romantic enough for a nice night out. Everything on the menu is amazing but my favorites are the Duck Confit and Waffles and for dessert the Mexican Hot Chocolate Cake!

photos.caption: Photo of Carpe Diem Restaurant & Caterers - Charlotte, NC, United States. I dream about this Duck Confit and Waffles entree drizzled with maple syrup...

VB8Idy7sI9c3jCLTOYO_yQ.text: The very definition of a "meh" restaurant. It's certainly not bad, but I certainly have no desire to go again -- especially with the exorbitant prices it charges. I paid $20 for a vegetarian mushroom bolognese, and aside from the fact that I could have made this at home, I would have preferred to pay half that price at Mama Ricotta's and gotten better-tasting food.   Cocktails were the star of the menu.   Other than that, just meh.

VgCrlGkJRBNtPTRtrM7QMA.text: "Outstanding!" As my husband said during a birthday dinner we had.  The food was worth every penny.  We started out with the seared tuna as an appetizer.  Our entrees were the buttermilk fried chicken and filet of beef, both were amazing.  The sauteed kale with the filet was exceptional. For dessert we ordered the fruit cobbler, which for that time of the year it was blackberry and very delicious.  None of the food was too heavy, so you don't feel overbearingly stuffed when you leave but just right!

photos.caption: Photo of Carpe Diem Restaurant & Caterers - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Carpe Diem Restaurant & Caterers - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Carpe Diem Restaurant & Caterers - Charlotte, NC, United States

V2fTakSdm_wHYVSUthdPLg.text: I went here last Friday night with my loved one. We ordered dishes on the restaurant week menu.   The beet salad and salmon entree I ordered were not impressive. They are good, but not as good as the other dishes I tried in other same level restaurants in town. I'm not a big fan of the salad dressing on the beets. The salmon was served with potatoes, which were pretty bland.   On the other hand, the grape salad and the pork tenderloin entree were very good.  I'm not sure if I will come back again if I have other choices.

vffzYhS97f9pstY1aHy9Nw.text: We followed the restaurant's aphorism and seized the day, only to be reassured that my husband's culinary skills are far superior when it comes to making their most "famous" dishes. The grilled grape salad is nothing special at all. I didn't find the flavor combination to be balanced. The buttermilk fried chicken was just ok. It's two breasts that are obviously brined, wet battered and then fried. Not much flavor or seasoning except in the gravy, which is a milk based white gravy, so has breakfasty feel. The mashed potatoes were good but the spinach was unseasoned. The coffee creme brulee has an excellent flavor but a weak texture.  All in all, I was underwhelmed but now I know! The hype isn't real.  Highest Recommendation: The Seafood Soup, which happened to be tonight's special.

y0qr_dgBeK37SkyHNOqGNg.text: Had a wonderful waitress! The menu was a great selection and the food was wonderful! The only negative I would have is that the restaurant was extremely warm, almost to the point of sweating. Other than that it was perfect!

tpuJAdEmuXVoQQWI636lLA.text: Had dinner at this place last night. The swordfish was pretty good. My date had the fried chicken breast and I must say his meal was way better. Not that mine was bad lol. I ordered the house cappuccino with Bailey's after. It was really good. I could see myself going back. The staff was really attentive and the atmosphere is great.

nxpyIr9JGgXea2d06kUuiw.text: Really good experience here, but not going to be my newest food addiction. The house salad included strawberries, feta cheese, and pumpkin seeds, which I inhaled. They had enough salt/pepper on the salad as well as balsamic dressing done right. I also had the shrimp & grits, which had pinto beans. That was unique, but flavored well and the shrimp were large and w/out a tail. A vegetarian option that subbed mushroom for shrimp was available. My friend had the duck confit and was pleased. Their butter for the bread was a bit salty. Service was great, as the waitress had an impressive command over an expansive menu. Drinks were tasty, but weak. Overall, I see why this place is hyped. Everything was really flavorful and made from quality ingredients and the service is second to none.

photos.caption: Photo of Carpe Diem Restaurant & Caterers - Charlotte, NC, United States. Duck confit
Photo of Carpe Diem Restaurant & Caterers - Charlotte, NC, United States. House salad
Photo of Carpe Diem Restaurant & Caterers - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and grits did not disappoint

h_o5nAAgWass-oAZyJwC6A.text: 5 stars for the food, 2 for the atmosphere.  I'll start out by saying the food was absolutely incredible. Definitely one of the best meals I've ever had. I had the fried chicken and my husband had the steak, both dishes were very reasonable in price and were crazy good.  The restaurant and decor looks very dated, the atmosphere is not what I was expecting at all. We got drinks at custom shop ahead of time and it was a huge difference in atmosphere and feel. With some minor lighting and decor updates to match the quality of the food, this would easily be one of the best restaurants in town all around.

s5uKn21U3NhoEXPbnxZe5g.text: It didn't blow my mind but it was good food. Nothing memorable to make me want to come back to try another dish, which is why it's downgraded to a four-star.  Fancy interior and cuisine!

zfTOZqQUs1OkadCFSz7wiA.text: This place is incredible. Based on a friend's advice, I ordered apps only and we split them for dinner. I also love main courses like their famous fried chicken . We shared several apps and all were incredibly savory and delicious. The menu changes seasonally! Some of my favorites have been oyster beignets and they were like a sophisticated hush puppy with a spicy finish. When we had the pizzette combo of goat cheese, tomato coulis and baby asparagus rocked my world. I enjoyed their fried chicken entree for savory chicken! Their cocktails are fantastic! Parking is in the lot nearby. Reservations are needed on weekends.

f3BTKiA-qkUCDxd5nGtJxg.text: Delicious food! Walked in for my birthday dinner reservation and they seated us right away. The space is elegant with dim lighting and flower decorations from the lights to centerpieces. Our server was very welcoming and they decorated our table with birthday confetti.   Our server explained everything in great detail along with their specials menu. We ordered the duck breast and a fillet of beef. Both were delicious and were on their standard menu! My fillet of beef was cooked a perfect medium and served with a addictive puree. The duck was slightly over cooked but still savory and melted in your mouth.   We will definitely be back again! The service and the food were excellent. What a great way to wrap up my evening! Oh! And the creme brulee was exquisite!!

photos.caption: Photo of Carpe Diem Restaurant & Caterers - Charlotte, NC, United States. Got the place to ourselves! Came here for a late birthday dinner.

4Ez9b0TH6SjU_WKmO7Vuwg.text: We had an exceptional experience celebrating my mother's birthday tonight. Food and service were top level. David went above and beyond. One of the best restaurants in Charlotte.

71ntQiUwGdM70EXWg2yS8g.text: One of our favorite stops of restaurant week. The Meze Plate has just the right amount of spice and authentic flavor. The steak was cooked to perfection. But the star of the show was the Byrrhattan (Manhattan). I may have had one too many. They were just too good to put down! Great ambience (though it can be a little quiet if you have "loud talkers" in your group) and a friendly staff. The waitress never took our dessert order, then made one up instead of asking "you had the cheesecake right?" Ummm no, but we cut her some slack due to the restaurant week madness. Will definitely be back and already recommended to about a dozen friends!

photos.caption: Photo of Carpe Diem Restaurant & Caterers - Charlotte, NC, United States

hk8y2NfXGSvVF9AMGHptxA.text: I have been here several times.  In fact it was my favorite spot since moving down to Charlotte.  My experience last time left me with very bad taste.  The server outright lied about what she was serving my 10 year old niece.  She then tried to charge me for things she didn't serve.  The manager was not even interested in hearing my complaint.  I even wrote to them but that went unnoticed as well.  I have been to this place about 10 times with usually a large group.  You can be assured will never go back.

ixTrJvmrKhvFC1_hkIvEiw.text: I can't believe I wait years before I actually went to Carpe Diem. I am now highly disappointed in myself for waiting this long! I don't know if it was the night we came or if it is like this all the time. Nevertheless, the food was hands down fantastic!   We went for restaurant week so it was a great deal for $35. I have to rave about the pork chops first. I don't eat a lot of pork but if I had to choose one meal for the rest of my life that was pork it would be from the chefs of Carpe Diem. The textures and flavors of the sweet potato puree with the sauce was the perfect combination. I would have never thought to put these flavors together but it worked!   The salads were fresh and delicious as well. The dessert was really good and worth it. Service was great and very prompt ! I can't wait to come back for restaurant week or just in general. It was a great experience and I highly recommend it.

l6E3LueD54W206o5MMf0nQ.text: We've been here a couple of times. The food always brings us back. It's outstanding from presentation to palate. Prepare to spend some. Our first time there we spent over 2 bills. The last time around 1.5 bills. And that's with appetizers,drinks,entrees,desserts and gratuity   for 2. -Pat

2gtdSKMGQdBZhQo_O0DV1A.text: I read the reviews from this place and was a little hesitant. However, the best way to form your opinion is to see for yourself, right? I went for a birthday dinner. We had a large party with a reservation and our waiter Mike was outstanding. He was patient and catered to our needs. This was a Tuesday night so I'm not sure if this would have been different on a high traffic night like a weekend. However, his personality was great!   I got the warm goat cheese salad and it was amazing. The apricot jalapeno vinaigrette is very good and compliments the entire dish. Everyone else got the highly recommended fried chicken. I had the option to taste this and let me tell you, IT WAS GREAT! Somebody's grandma is either in the back or gave this recipe for the chicken. The meat is tinder, juicy, and flavorful. The coating is crispy and very savory. It's served with sauteed spinach and mashed potatoes.   Overall, this place was very good and I will definitely be back! Thanks, Mike!

iYm3nKgkR_GKc-BXtoEtbQ.text: My girlfriend and I went to Carpe Diem for dinner and had an overall pleasant dining experience. The serving staff was very polite and attentive. I ordered the venison and she ordered the scallops for our entrees. Both entrees were nice, although I personally preferred the scallops. The salads were great as well. Conveniently located in the Elizabeth area of Charlotte with warm vibes and decor. Enjoy!

lxNR8GQnEW5iuAbvzcRqtA.text: We came for Restaurant Week back in January.   We parked in street parking which was very convenient considering the lot nearby was very full.  The restaurant itself was very nice looking with a very large bar and seating area.   It's dimly lite in there which leads to a nice ambiance. We were seated in the back of the restaurant at a nice little table for 4.   We were first given a basket of bread and butter. The bread wasn't anything to write home about, but I like when there is a bread basket.   As we looked over the menu for Restaurant Week and ordered drinks - the waitress filled our waters up.   Due to Restaurant Week, we were working off of a paired down menu, but unlike other restaurants during this week the options were still great.   I ordered the warm goat cheese salad as my salad starter. It was delicious, very fresh and the warm goat cheese was cooked to perfection. Just enough ooze!   For my entree I ordered the Scottish salmon which had a Mediterranean take on it. The labneh served with it was divine!  For dessert i ordered the chocolate cake with caramel icing and salted toffee popcorn. This is an unusual order for me as I do not like chocolate cake, but something about it sounded good-- and I was right! It wasn't too overpowering or heavy like a lot of chocolate cakes.   All in all I was pleasantly surprised with Carpe Diem and I look forward to coming back and dining outside of restaurant week!

r63mEdIj0Fe0Vi65Y0yIVQ.text: Liked the restaurant - but a couple fails on their part.  First - the good.  The food was actually really good.  While I did not get the buttermilk chicken - one of my friends did - and OMG, it looked and tasted amazing.  If we go back, that's what I'm ordering.  Now, the bad.  Prior to the entrees, we were served a cleansing sorbet (awesome right?).  However, the "kid" just set them down in front of each of us - not explaining what it was/the flavor/or anything.  Was just odd.  I ordered the Prince Edward Island Steamed Mussels and the Local Duck Wings as an entree.  I love mussels but thought I needed more than just that for dinner - hence the wings.  Both require the use of fingers and can get messy/sticky pretty easily.  I expect a nice restaurant to offer a warm towel towards the end of my meal to clean my hands - come on, even Buffalo Wild Wings gives me wet naps!  But, no such towel.  I ended up pouring some water from my glass onto my napkin and hitting up the restroom.    Prices weren't bad (including beer/wine prices).  Service was good for the most part.  A good restaurant in Elizabeth, but could be better.

zJs3So1uG4600ihLdVmN4g.text: Great place and great food. The server was very kind and the food was awesome.   The cheese was very fresh and made in NC and the prices were reasonable.   I will come back again :)

8RO0t9d2PBJnPa1-cFTchw.text: This is an awesome restaurant.  It is perfect for a cozy and intimate date night.  I, however, came with coworkers...which works too.  The place has an elegant feel and sexy vibe.  The service was divine!  This was my first time and the waitress was helpful with the menu.  I got the filet cooked medium...even that was a little too under cooked for me, which it isn't usually..so I had to send it back, but after that it was delicious.  The o my thing I didn't like was my dessert...it was so dry and awful that I don't even remember what is was.  One bite and done...maybe a bread pudding?  Ugh..either way...glad it was forgotten and a positive experience remains.  I would love to come back here and try some of the other delectable entrees!!

aelL-eSTp0dNRgQ6Y2DYOA.text: My boyfriend and I went here for Valentine's Day dinner. We had a reservation for 9pm, but didn't end up being seated until about 9:20, which was annoying. Other than that, everything was great. Atmosphere, food, and service were awesome. I had the crab fondue for appetizer, shrimp conchiglie for my entree, and the red velvet pound cake for dessert. All were delicious. Overall, I recommend!

iRbuVwXQDA1GX7RDQNKJGw.text: There is a reason Carpe Diem has been on all of the top restaurant lists for nearly 30 years - it really is a Charlotte gem! The food and service are outstanding and consistent. Carpe Diem is a great place to celebrate a special occasion, and definitely a restaurant worthy of taking out-of-town guests for an evening out. Come here most night during the week and you'll have a quiet, intimate dining experience. On weekend nights this place can get a little loud, but not boisterous or obnoxious.

K4R39ioJQT8j77YdrwTDoA.text: I picked this restaurant for a business dinner based upon the reviews and was not one bit disappointed. My colleagues and I were in town for a big meeting the next day with a customer here.   We parked across the street in the lot designated for the shops/restaurants and had to drive around for a few minutes before finding someone leaving to get a spot. Immediately made me think we'd be in for a wait in a very busy restaurant.  Not the case at all! We definitely walked into a busy restaurant but they immediately took us to our table to be seated. Sometimes even with reservations you'll have a wait at really popular restaurants but it was a pleasant and unexpected surprise to not have that here; especially given the packed parking lot.  We were seated at a corner table by the windows which was nice as it provided a relatively quiet environment for us to discuss our customer visit for the next day and plan everything out.   Service was immediate as well and spot on. No empty water glasses, no "where'd the waiter go?", no wondering if we would ever receive food. Drinks brought promptly, excellent staff! Spot on service.  The food was fantastic!! Met every bit of the high bar set by other reviewers. We tried a variety of things at our table and all thought what they ordered was spectacular. I'd point them out but given we ordered a pretty broad spectrum of their offering I'd just recommend that you go with whatever sounds best to you because I don't think any are going to disappoint.   They also had a decent wine list with a mix of both French, Italian, Spanish, California, and Oregon wines. Several beer on tap options. Full bar.  If I lived here this place would definitely be at the top of my list of dining out options.

6QVhtXcIxGAIlqoIiKZo9A.text: Very few times you have a dining experience where everything is great from beginning to end. The restaurant is centrally located. The Decor is warm and elegant without being intimidating. You can have a nice conversation without having to raise your voice to be heard. The service is attentive and professional and not snooty like in other upscale restaurants. Now the best part, the food. The prices are equivalent to the quality of the food. The portions are not as small as in other upscale restaurants, where you pay a lot and get tiny portions. All the dishes we ordered were perfectly made and very tasteful. Palate cleanser: sorbet before main entree, nice touch that many upscale restaurants forgo. They have a great selection of wine, served in nice wine glasses, not in clunky wine glasses. The experience at Carpe Diem was more like what you get and expect at a restaurant in Greenwich Village, NY. Can't wait to come back!

9OuAeVPgYfaxf262CYsTcQ.text: I took my niece there in place of a prom (she's home schooled). The parking is metered & can be scarecrow depending on when you go. The environment is beautiful, the food was delicious & our waitress was friendly & provided great service. The restaurant was busy but I did not feel like we got overlooked or like it was too loud in there. Formal enough for prom dates & they had a shortened prom menu specifically for that on the night we went. Overall, a wonderful experience.

Photo of Carpe Diem Restaurant & Caterers - Charlotte, NC, United States

3E6jIc5k0ZQ2W_sod_7jpg.text: We came for Easter at the only reservation left - 2:45pm. They rushed us to order the moment we were seated, stating the kitchen was closing at 3pm.   At 2:50pm as the table was being seated next to us we complained about being rushed and the waiter said the manager "confirmed the kitchen will close at 3pm."  The table next to us was rushed even more.   Our French Onion soup bowls were only half filled and luke warm and had to be sent back to be heated. We were never offered bread to use our bread plates with until we asked at 3:30pm.   The entrees arrived 45 minutes after ordering at 3:40pm.   Our waiter was cool and unwelcoming. The manager knew we were unhappy and never came over to talk with us.   The food was just fine. Nothing more.   Overall it was a significant disappointment to what should have been a great holiday meal with family.

pq7F7dfdAWIlUsxsqUVKQg.text: From the moment I was seated service was very rushed.  The bread was almost thrown on the table by the person delivering it because he rushed by so quickly... which would make sense if the restaurant was packed.. but it was not.    The waitress was also very rushed and when I asked if the Mushroom Bolognese had shiitake in it (I stated I was allergic) she sort of shrugged her shoulders..and said something to the effect of "it should be fine/I don't think so."  The person I was with more firmly stated I was allergic since she bypassed the question and took that down as my order anyway.  She went to the kitchen and came back to let us know it did have shiitake....  close call for me.  I ordered the salmon (medium) instead and it was very much overcooked.  Then the bill came with items not ordered on it... which I hope were better than my salmon.  TL; DR Rushed service, overcooked entree, and a blase attitude towards food allergies.

nZPa4j6uCEllHUCJnVQYDA.text: This restaurant is always a joy. Since it's origins downtown, through the current evolution. The tuna appetizer was fantastic. Interrupted with the complimentary sorbet (peanut butter and banana this time) and the pork for main. Very friendly staff make for a great finish

ecOOc7qWGn96gGEFnDMBGQ.text: Pistachio, grilled grape, blue cheese and light olive dressing are such a combination, and an easy try out salad at home

k1byP9G-xwNIsKKznzO3tw.text: One of three or four top restaurants in Charlotte. The food is excellent the room is pretty and I have never had anything but excellent service here.  When you are out to dinner and it is a special occasion or you do not want to risk ruining your evening by bad or indifferent service this is the place to go. A few other restaurants have great food but they fall down when it comes to service or decor.  If you are impressing a member of the opposite sex you will not go wrong with starting your evening here. After dinner at Carpe Diem any failure to have a great evening or weekend is yours alone.

aVYEzil5IbO95WBfJHMDFg.text: Great food and service in good atmosphere.  Reasonably priced.  Will definately get back there.

9kHpLRFQExOjBHg5X3GBiA.text: If they had a 2.5 star option i would choose that and this is why:  Went there with my fiance for my birthday last night.  We had heard it was good food and thought it would be nice.  I had a reservation through open table and was seated promptly.  Then we sat..  and sat... and sat...  and got some bread... then sat...  then we ordered!  when looking at the menu. their are not a lot of choices, so we figured that every choice had to be amazing.. because the reviews and such were so good.  we got the flat bread pizza with goat cheese and other stuff.. it was pretty good and i thought we were back on track.. we order the beef filet and the fried chicken for dinner.  the beef we wanted "well".. when it came out it was all pink.. so we sent it back. when it came back it was still pink...  Even the waitress (who was great and nice) was like this is wrong and not well...  but i was not about to send it back for a 2nd time..   so we kept it.  the fried chicken was good.. but i have had better.. To be honest Prices chicken or Macs beer can chicken is better.. and for the price we paid i was expecting it to be better..... and even though they were really good, mash potatoes are still mash potatoes..  because it was my birthday and the filet mix up..the waitress gave me crem brulee. which was a great desert.  Overall it was just a big ball of "ok".. The waitress was fantastic and nice.. our bill was 68$ so i gave her 80$ total.  but for 80$ i feel i could have found better food that was prepared a bit better.  Overall i would probably not eat there again.  no reason to spend 80$ on a big ball of "OK"  Disclaimer:  I recently moved here from NY (within the last 6 months)..  so maybe my thoughts are different than what it is down here.

5xkVrf6YsXejsqyf5KO7kw.text: The food was decent, the decor needs some work.   I went on a Monday night with two co-workers.  We showed up at about 8PM and were promptly asked by the host "Do you have reservation?".  No.  It's Monday.  There were 6 other people in the restaurant.  Why even ask if we had reservations?  The decor looks a bit dated.  I was expecting a pretty hip joint, instead got a old fashion restaurant.  Pretty bright too.  Some might find it charming.    Started off with some martinis.  I asked for extra dry, got a pretty wet vodka martini.  Fine, whatever.    Appetizers were probably the low point of the night - The seared tuna was about average (although pretty small).  The beef carpaccio left a lot to be desired.  While it was tender, it feel apart on us.  You HAD to use the fried wonton skins to eat it.  I love carpaccio, but the asian theme with it just didn't fly with me.   The main course was nice.  I had a grilled chicken breast with black rice.  I would order it again if I went.    Didn't order dessert.  Wine - We ordered a pretty expensive bottle of red wine.  The bottle was really warm - disappointing.  It should have been at least a little bit chilled.   I'll go back if someone is paying, but probably won't go on my own.

RzHm7Lvie-be0qQ2CTc3kw.text: This splurge restaurant located in Elizabeth happens to be one of my top 5 favorites in Charlotte!  I've never had a bad meal.  They have a seasonal menu with plenty of vegetarian choices and pride themselves on having several local organic farm partners.  Hot fresh bread served with butter, the warm goat cheese salad (I get this everytime), their made fresh daily desserts...it's all good!  And they also cater.

cC8YiGz3cx_QSP8ijMn8CA.text: Service was great. Waitress was friendly. Had fried chicken and a filet. I thought the filet was over priced for  quality of meat received. The fried chicken was delicious and I would recommend to anyone. Overall a good experience.

vznwd6hx2F-DbpPMILKLlw.text: hostess a little forgetful. great ambiance.  awesome cuisine.

XbApFj3G5P-gBm2oHpV1EA.text: Has been one of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte for years! They make great cocktails and their creme brulee is delicious!

PX_sjd618AQZuJFLUkS_6g.text: Carpe Diem is always excellent. Food, service and atmosphere all good. It's a nice place but not at all stuffy. Prices are fair for the quality. We've never been disappointed.

2lZJpC0sxoyYgWiyxEKj0g.text: Carpe Diem is one of my favorite places to go for a special evening, or just for a great cocktail at the front bar.  I've taken business colleagues, friends and my husband all for wonderful dinners.  The menus covers all palettes from steaks to vegetarian, and often does the specials.  Don't see how anyone can go wrong here.  It is a quieter restaurant, but easily handles groups and parties with reservations.  I'm making myself hungry to go right now!  By the way, I once had their homemade pumpkin gnocchi (it was a special) and it was terrific!

gAxvHSE5A1Bm8cxBW0lDWw.text: Worth checking out.  The food was good and the scene is relaxed.

rzgEImRcj5OaJOst75wwvw.text: On a recent visit I had the duck which was tender enough to cut with a fork and extremely well flavored. The spinach and parmasean soup was out of this world! A fanastic find and very enjoyable atmoshpere. Resonably priced wine and good service make this a "I'll be back" restaurant.

GJGbfY2bFWr1QcrtWPvVqg.text: I'm really ambivalent about this place. On one hand, the atmosphere is comfy and the staff are professional without a lot of attitude. But the menu is uninspired and the portions are stingy, especially for the price.

IzupmeZ1CRlKFDiYSudc1w.text: This place has real good ambiance. Went for a valentine date to this place last year with prior reservation. We tried the fresh squid in the appetizers and they were great. Personally I am a big fan of calamari. They were well fried and crisp. The side sauce served with squids were nice. We had the Buttermilk Fried Chicken Breast and the Mountain Trout which was the catch of the day in seafood. We had a lovely evening. The service was great and our server provided us good information on the catch of the day. This place is definitely a $$$

_k-D90NxIyYrIoh6dYJm1A.text: Wow! This was the first time my husband and I have ever been to Carpe Diem but it will not be our last. Today was our anniversary so the decorated a private table for us. Another touch they gave us was desserts with a candle amongst other unique perks. The food was outstanding. We had the vegetable pizzetta to start, for entrees: salmon, and the duck. Dessert (made in house): mocha Oreo pie with mascarpone whipped cream and coconut cake with ice cream. Yum! Portions were huge for a fancy restaurant. Ask for Yolanda if you're looking for a great server. You won't be disappointed!

k0KKGGzOqUzNMWI14XSDOQ.text: Carpe Diem is one of those gems I wish I had discovered years ago.  It is on the pricy side, but boy, will you get out of there happy.  These people know how to serve the best food: The carpaccio was tender and defrosted to the right amount.  The hanger steak was cooked properly and to perfection.  And don't me started on the grilled grape salad.  I could go back just for that.   They know their wines - the recommendation of the Spanish white was 100% spto on.  The service was impeccable and the place is gorgeous - decor, architecture and the location in the heart of Elizabeth Avenue.

AnmgVDItv1iC6zWMzsmQ9A.text: Yes, 5 stars for this wonderful restaurant. It's now one of my Charlotte favorites and I'd urge readers to seize the day (ok, had to say it!) and give my new fave a try.  The atmosphere is lovely - white tablecloth service, beautiful oversized floral paintings/photos adorn the walls, polished wood throughout and faux flickering candles on the tables. A low murmur could be heard throughout the room but it was not overpowering (not a fan of noisy restaurants).  The service is outstanding.  Attentive, smiling, helpful and friendly from the host staff to the wait staff.  And the food?  Heavenly.  I went with a group of 6 and all were unanimous in praise of their meals.  Warm sourdough bread with sweet butter that melted in my mouth was a good place to start.  If you like goat cheese, you'll want to try the warm goat cheese salad with apricot jalapeno vinaigrette dressing. The goat cheese is encrusted in hazelnuts and the flavor and texture are outstanding.  For an entree, I ordered the pork chop prepared medium (first time in years I've had a pork chop and I was a bit nervous to try).  Marinated in apple cider and grilled, served with a divine jalapeno and goat cheese cornbread pudding and carrots, this was a pork chop for the ages.  Oh my goodness...I'm serious here though a bit effusive.  It was really that good.  Even better was the cornbread pudding and some type of salsa verde on top that brought all the flavors of the meal together.  I would order it again were it not for my desire to try every other selection during my next visit.  Which will be very soon.  Dessert selection was Belgian chocolate cake with a raspberry sauce.  This is my favorite combination of dessert flavors and it was quite good.  I skipped my normal girlie martini so can't report on the skill of the barkeep here but the wine list had very good selections and thankfully I chose well on this evening.  Enjoy great food?  Add Carpe Diem to your list!

JRHUIe9dEdWS-YpbgoQp-A.text: Fantastic meal with impeccable service and decor that would leave Alphonse Mucha green with envy.  Confronted with a hunger and desire to take advantage of restaurant week, we showed up on a Friday night around 5 without a reservation and was--amazingly--able to get a seat at a small table in the bar area.  Bread, service, and water came quickly from the attentive and friendly staff. After ordering we were attended to just the right amount: not too pushy, yet not absent.  While enjoying the bread, which is fabulously fluffy on the inside and crispy on the outside, we soaked in the ambiance: romantically lite room, beautiful woodwork, and mesmerizing back-lit vines.  For the first course, we shared two salads, the goat cheese  and the grilled grape. Both are fantastic. I particularly enjoyed the blue cheese vinaigrette on the grilled grape, which only hints at its blue cheese roots.  Next, we had the (famous) buttermilk fried chicken and vegetarian cous cous. Again, both were wonderful. The chicken was slightly battered and fried, which was a refreshing contrast to to more traditional fried chicken. The cous cous is a cornucopia of veggies and, well cous cous, in a light tangy sauce that I couldn't get enough of. Both are highly recommended.  Finally, dessert involved sharing a walnut and pecan pie (delicious, but I like my desserts like I like my chocolate--with chocolate) and a chocolate (yay!) bread pudding. The latter earned a paragraph unto itself.  Through years of diligent research, I've reached the conclusion that many chocolaty cake desserts are a let down. They are either not moist enough, too sweet, not sweet enough, too much, or just not satisfying. Yet still, time after time, I trepidatiously order the chocolate whatever in hopes that somehow, this time would be different. Usually, I am let down. However, this time at Carpe Diem it was different: this was the perfect mix of chocolaty goodness delivered via an appropriately moist vehicle for facilitating the devouration (yes, I just made that word up) of said chocolatly goodness (the bread pudding). I realize my error has always been relying on the traditional 'cake' delivery method. No longer. If ever you get the chance, you need to devourate (oops, I did it again) this chocolate bread pudding  In a final note, there is the bar area and the official dining area. We actually preferred the bar area on account of the lighting and more intimate nature of the experience. Still, the dining area has beautifully crafted art nouveau woodwork, a flower centerpiece, and wonderful artwork. I would return just to admire the place.

YwyGP-r1-0Uk9SnQ0PGU5A.text: Outstanding from start to finish. Great food at a reasonable price. My wife and I will be back soon.

7s1EhctEN7wA16oml_mWAQ.text: I went here for restaurant week and had an amazing experience!!!  First of all, the ambiance is awesome - cool back-lite vine and flower designs all around the bar area along with arch-shaped ceilings in the main dining room with crazy windy metal vines and flower lights.  The service was perfect.  My water glass was never less than half full and all of the food arrived in a prompt, well timed order.  There was always someone there to check on us, but not in an intrusive way.  The food was delicious!  The bread is fresh, warm, flaky on the outside, and soft on the inside.  I started with the hazelnut goat cheese salad which was amazing.  Then I had the fried chicken breast with mashed potatoes and spinach for my entree.  Apparently this is one of their most popular dishes, and I can see why.  The chicken was battered and fried to perfection and covered with a light, flavorful gravy.  The chicken was served on the mashed potatoes and wilted spinach.  Surprisingly, the dish did not feel heavy, like most fried chicken entrees.  I ended with the chocolate-carmel bread pudding for dessert - it was also awesome!  Nice and warm and gooey with a scoop of vanilla ice cream on top.  The waitress told us about 1/2 off wine bottle and appetizer specials during the week - so I definitely will be going back to Carpe Diem!!!  If you are looking for a quiet, romantic, intimate setting for a date, this is the perfect place!

rIu81UWBDjSi1VZbieL4og.text: 4.5 stars - Menu changes frequently - so does kitchen staff - food taste different all the time - not a bad thing, just different - love the freshness and their creativity - staff knows the menu and the food

ilLv50YTL7ydTAGFPdX1cQ.text: I dined at Carpe Diem during restaurant week with a group of 7 others. The goat cheese salad featured some tasty onions and tart goat cheese, but the dressing was lacking in flavor and it definitely didn't live up to the expectation that several "yelpers" had set. The salmon entree was spot-on, and the relish topping popped with incredible flavor. Finally, the chocolate pudding was decadent and the perfect end to the meal. My only complaint was the service. Our waitress appeared to be in a less-than-enthusiastic mood from the start. She rushed our drink orders within 30 seconds of being seated, required that we order appetizer, entree, and dessert all at once, failed to refill drinks, and then made errors on our receipts. I love enjoying a fancy meal out, but there is simply nothing more frustrating than sub-par service. For more details, including pictures, you can read my complete review. trifoodiemd.blogspot.com...

zZjih-p3I3C_XhsVwJSyFA.text: Not worth the money. Better places than this. It is a very cold and somewhat militant place. If we are paying over 200 a couple than you should have your staff (at the very least) say hello or welcome as they walk by our table. Why can't employees act kind to those who are dining in their home? Say hello. Say thank you for coming in. Ask how we are. Very cold. And that woman who (tonight) was walking around dragging her feet (sorry if it is a health issue but really we are in an upscale place) please stay off the main floor. Annoying. And speaking of floors. Update the interior of your place. So cold. My scallops were delicious but I got 3. Yes 3. How fing insulting. The ravioli app was cold and tasteless. The oysters were warm. Need I say more?  Run.

vIvWzW-A1Mm3Z7U4bbD3kA.text: Decent food.  No desire to go back for a second try.  Salad was good but the fried chicken is very bland.  I don't know why the place is supposedly known for fried chicken but it does not even break my top 10 for fried chicken.  I'm from the south and know fried chicken.  It was tender but very, very bland.

aF2FPhNcZznQi7BXp6iosg.text: Really enjoyed this restaurant!  Food was good and everyone in my party enjoyed their meal. The cocktails were very good and reasonably priced. This is one of my favorites in Charlotte. Mushroom Bolognese pasta was terrific.

4U6XjxVv941WJbczgPHu1A.text: My favorite place in Charlotte. Good food, good service, good atmosphere. And the fried chicken, while it doesn't sound exactly like haute cuisine, it is. And it's surprises like this that makes Carpe Diem the venerable establishment that it is.

yCqL_PoR0yVk5YMSX9GBGw.text: Carpe Diem is always a hit!  Outstanding service, delicious food and a warm and welcoming atmosphere.  Whenever we want a special dinner out or have out of town guests this is our TOP restaurant.  Grateful to have this special gem right in our neighborhood!!

o5386oYV99G_bS7OchBvGw.text: ** update ** owner contacted us  & smoothed our ruffled feathers!  Very happy that owner is paying attention & is willing to address concerns.  We have made another reservation to check it out again & will (hopefully) upgrade star rating after this next visit!    Rating is for Hostesses.  Our first visit. Hostesses rude & we rqstd & wanted to sit in the nicer front window area. There were two tables open but she said they were reserved & sat us at teeny round bar table. Back of restaurant isn't as nice as the front pictures they show in all ads & our rqst for a table w/view was ignored. We ordered bottle of wine, appetizers, two entrees, & dessert and were there 2+hours and those tables sat empty the whole time. We asked the hostess about that & she responded poorly. The bartender was our waitress & she was awesome & truly nice. The food was good (House Salad, Filet of Beef, Pork Cutlet, Red Pepper Soup, Madonna Riesling) but not good enough to go back & be treated rudely. Oh, & they cancelled our reservation in the Open Table system after we arrived so I had to contact Open Table to reinstate.  One of my pet peeves in Charlotte in general is the crappy hostesses.  The first impression can make or break it for me.

RAz5JQTQ4PIpKQGG0Em3Ag.text: Carpe Diem is a special place.  The interior looks like it's been there forever, maybe as some old, upscale law firm or church, but it's also updated and modern, and you spend the meal trying to figure out how to update your house to look exactly like this.  The prices signify that this will be a celebratory meal, but it also isn't too expensive that you couldn't just be celebrating a darn good Wednesday.  And the level and quality of service is impecable.  Our waitress asked if we had somewhere we needed to be after dinner and if there was a certain time we needed to be out of there by - perhaps my date's tuxedo tipped her off?  Regardless, she kept us on schedule and (we realized when she brought it) had even tagged the check with our goal departure time.  As we left the restaurant, I looked at the clock and realized we were 5 minutes ahead of the time she wrote down; now that's service.  With the stage set now for a great evening, the food doesn't disappoint.  My boyfriend and I each ordered the goat cheese salad, which had a surprisingly sweet and spicy kick from the jalapeno apricot dressing.  For our entrees, he got the duck, which was slightly pink, succulently juicy, and perfectly topping a mouthwatering sweet potato polenta.  Are you drooling yet?  I ordered the buttermilk fried chicken, and I almost proposed to it, it was that good.  There's no "if you love something, set it free" mentality here; I scraped up the last little tidbits with a smile on my face.  By the time dessert came, I could barely finish my chocolate caramel bread pudding, but I tried my best; although I was nearly married to the fried chicken, I'd consider taking the bread pudding as a lover.    Carpe the experience, and enjoy!

TdlJu1HegLxahk7Hhmn8Mw.text: The venue is intimate and can either be dressy or casual. Carpe Diem has an excellent staff who take care of all your dining needs.  Carpe Diem has the best fried chicken in North Carolina.  John, one of the senior staff members and bar tenders is the best

RaDr8O9M0xPX-lOo1t3A8A.text: Yelp brought us here, and it is as good as it gets!  This restaurant lives up to all the great reviews it has garnered here on yelp.  Atmosphere is cozy, service is phenomenal!, and food was sooo great!    The goat cheese salad was to die for!  Entrees were so good, and so were the desserts.  It was a wonderful dinner and I definitely will come back.

VO-v_jZsPmEjUo7lM2Xu-A.text: This is a follow up to an earlier review I wrote about this restaurant.  I recently ate here again and the experience was just as phenomenal as the first time.  The environment still reminds me of something from The Hobbit.  It is so unique and intimate feeling inside.  There is truly nothing like this place in way of atmosphere in all of Charlotte.  As you might imagine, the food is to die for.  That said, save room for dessert.  You have to try the creme brulee or something on the dessert menu anyway - it is all amazingly delicious!    That said, a few things I would I would highly recommend: make reservations since Carpe gets busy and plan out your parking strategy before you get there.  I really mean it about the parking because if you go on a day when it is busy, you will search and search for legal parking.  Nothing will spoil a night more than finishing a wonderful dinner only to discover you have a ticket or your car has been towed.  My car was safe on this visit - thank goodness.

XRt4wroKkjhKtB0Bg9jcUQ.text: Terrible service and attitude of waitress and Manager. Would not spend my money at this establishment again. There are many other better choices in Chatlotte.

xGleeR92xYBZgJiXPgBHJA.text: Winter Panzanella salad=croutons were soft and soggy. The "poached egg" on top was merely egg whites...sounds like the chef needs to practice poaching eggs. Filet Mignon was a bit fatty and salty -- highly unusual for Filet since it's a blander meat. Disappointed.

7FYgW4Teblr-UZzLWJr57A.text: We have been to Carpe Diem a few times before their move to Elizabeth.  We tried it again tonight for our anniversary dinner.  Big Mistake. While granted, it was a Monday night (I get that in the restaurant industry), the food was pretty much awful.  Over-seasoned...overdone. Steak overcooked; Quail undecipherable in it's bed of black (white) rice and syrupy sweet sauce.  Wine overpriced. Salad uninteresting and dressing was boring.  Appetizer meatballs....well, regular meatballs without pasta. The descriptions were nice but the food didn't live up to it.  They had our table decorated (for our anniversary) but didn't offer a glass of wine, an appetizer , nor a dessert for our special occasion.  Expensive and um..."let's just go home and have a glass of wine." kind of night.

zwpDuYcyaW4UVApO8AABMA.text: Best service ever -  find Lovejoy behind the bar.  Divine grape salad.

dc0VtBTDauDQtXU-66t5Dw.text: Service 6/10 Food 7/10 Sorry I may be spoiled given I am coming from NY. But there was nothing great about the dishes for the prices. The service (long and wrong for which they apologized and comped a little for) was not good.

hLfwWqfsyZ6b0oFid8XhUA.text: My wife and I went there for the first time. My review will be kind of mixed so just hear it out first.   We made reservations and when we got there they were right on top of things taking our jackets and had the table ready. What was kind of a downfall was it literally took us 20 mins just to place an order for drinks so with all that time we just went ahead and placed our orders as well.   The bread and butter was pretty good. Our appetizer was the beef carpaccio, it was pretty good a different taste but not bad.   I ordered the Pork Chop it was a good but nothing amazing. I wasn't blown away from it like everything states. My wife got the buttermilk fried chicken but she said it also wasn't anything amazing.  For "fine" dinning the prices aren't bad and it is a nice place for a date night. Good spot and location.   I don't know if I went in there with high expectations or not, but overall it was an ok spot nothing extremely amazing. But I would go back later on down the road.

CoLWXiOuBtW4JY6Eaw5UPw.text: We went to Carpe Diem recently while visiting my family in Charlotte. We were really excited to eat here based on all the great things Yelpers had to say. The decor was nice, but nothing really special and it seemed a little generic to me. The service was ok as well, but again, nothing special.   We started with splitting the Warm Goat Salad and it was pretty good. We also ordered the Beef Carpaccio, and again it was good but nothing memorable. We also ordered the Cheese Plate but it never came to the table and we did not mention anything about it. It wasn't on our check so either the waitress didn't hear us order it or she forgot to put it in. For the entree I ordered the Filet of Beef and my wife ordered the Pork Chops which were the special the evening we went. Both were good and  I really enjoyed the red beet gnocchi that came with the steak. My mother ordered the friend chicken and it was amazing...def. the best thing I tried.   Overall I liked this place but just don't agree with most people who seem to think it's as good as it gets. The prices on the menu are very reasonable for a fine dining restaurant so that is a definite plus. I also like that they source from local farms. I don't know that I would jump at the chance to come here again...but wouldn't be opposed to it either.

aSvwXRMUHN3QE3w5oHfHwQ.text: I've been here twice now. On both occasions I must say that the food and drinks were over-the-top delicious.

VTQbpsNwJSlG-IW_--EpbA.text: Omg if I was a rich man...lol I'm singing the song because I could live in this place. The staff, food and all around display was impeccable in every way.  Just wish they had a second floor on the weekends. Lol  amazing

6ZbCEqfTk5GdER6saGJguw.text: I had the scallops and they were wonderful with the beurre blanc sauce and the black bass special was 8.5/10 but the rice and broccolini it came with was an 11/10. Beef carpaccio as an appetizer was very tasty and pretty presentation. Fresh bread on table and superb service.

1gY6IZc_XeCQm8YadQV7Kg.text: My fiance and I stopped in for a celebratory engagement date.  We both ordered the special that night which was a braised beef ragu over homemade pumpkin and ricotta gnocchi.  It was incredible. My only complaint is that I wished there was more.  And then dessert came... our waitress, who was very friendly and personable, informed us that one of the sisters that owns the restaurant also makes all the desserts and they change pretty frequently.  That night my fiance got what he calls the 'best thing he's ever eaten' which was a pumpkin gingerbread trifle (I believe) with caramel sauce.  I had the blueberry cobbler which was also really really good.  Overall, we loved this place and can't wait to go back the next time we are in the area!

EfsbEaai2Kqz-dKAIflY3w.text: I wanted to try this place out because of the raving reviews on trip advisor. I wonder if I came at a bad time, because everyone else on here seems to love it. I got some gross luke-warm tuna, and some "OK" chicken .. Drinks were good, which is why I went three stars instead of two.

gchp1-UliC7RC3GaQOZ53Q.text: Mothers Day brunch was somewhat disappointing. Our waitress was great and our salads and fried chicken entrees were very good. However, the shrimp and grits entree was entirely too small...The crepe was OK AND one small almost mini dry/dense cupcake per person was so disappointing.   If your party had four people, your table would receive 2 lemon and 2 chocolate small/mini cupcakes...most people at our table wanted choc, but only half of us got one. I'm sure we could have asked for all choc, but really..   This menu, in my opinion, was not worthy of a special occasion like Mothers' Day and certainly not worthy of a $30 price per person. I can get a salad, fried chicken entree, and mini cupcake for less than $30 just about anywhere.

U_ERshG2GQgaHeMj3AtxdQ.text: Here for Queen's Feast this past week and it was a sound choice I must say.  From the very beginning you can tell this is a great date night spot and my girlfriend and I were given a nice little two person table to help complete that scenario perfectly.  The food wasn't short of fantastic.  It was expertly prepared and plated very nicely upon presentation.  I was pretty impressed with all things, from the salad through the desert.  From looking over the menu I could tell this place has some very unique dishes that the chef staff has taken great care in putting together.  The service was great also, very specific and friendly service really helped finish the entire dining experience.  I will certainly be back to try it again.

GLMe2ABzYdWKsSyyYHkmpA.text: Carpe Diem was another selection for Summer Queen's Feast this year. I started my meal warm goat cheese salad (with wine poached onions, hazelnut crusted goat cheese, mixed greens and an apricot jalapeno vinegarette). I can't say no to warm goat cheese and it's rich, creamy texture; so was a bit disappointed that the feature of the dish, the goat cheese, was quite sparse (only two goat cheese, for lack of a better term, balls, adorned my salad). While I liked the concept of the crusted goat cheese, the crust was not quite crisp, and the texture felt like it needed a few more minutes of cooking. For my entree, I order the maple sorghum glazed hanger steak, which came with farro, vegetable pilaf and pickled fennel. This was an elevated comfort dish; the steak came nestled on the farro and veggies, and the flavors of all three complimented each other. The steak was cooked to my liking (rare, though the middle was a tad warm if we're splitting hairs); and was so incredibly juicy that I probably could have used a butter knife for slicing. However, the maple glaze was a bit sweet, and overpowered some bites to where I couldn't taste the meat and left a candied aftertaste in my mouth. As a self-proclaimed red meat connoseiur, it was a delicious and delightful steak, and I would wholeheartedly recommend the dish. At this point of the meal, I was proud of myself for wearing a highwaisted dress, because I felt like I was going to burst at the seams. Luckily, I have a sweet tooth and can always make room for dessert. For dessert, I ordered the coconut cream pie, which came highly recommended by our waitress, and she definitely knew what she was talking about. My slice of pie was decorated with salted caramel sauce and strawberries, and while I was a bit hesitant about the sweet, on sweet, on sweet, it totally worked and I ate the whole thing. The brightness and sweetnes of the fresh strawberries enhanced the coconut, and the caramel provided just the right amount of salty balance. It is one of the best desserts I've had at a restaurant! Read the full review here: offtheeatenpathblog.com/...

i_yH9An2SOTLExGry1C3IQ.text: Delicious food and wonderful date. Pork was unbelievably tasty.

mfAQtn6N97cPm3gho-I_7g.text: The food here is beyond excellent. We went there during restaurant  week and had one of the $30 dollar plates.  My dish was one of the best steaks I have ever had. The rest of the people I was with spoke very highly about their entrees also.  The best meal I have had in Charlotte!

Twf8JDDpSOdmS_BqPzYOuQ.text: We had a table of 10 people so we shared a few appetizers and my favorite were the Fresh Squid and Mediterranean Meze Plate. For dinner I ordered the Pork Chops and I was not disappointed. I highly recommend this place and since we had a few people that were vegetarian they too enjoyed their dishes. For dessert we ordered one of each...I forgot what they were but all of them were awesome. I would go back there in my next business trip.

tWHfiPcF2FZw0BYxu1cq0Q.text: Hands down some of the best seared scallops I've ever had. Wife had the fried chicken which I also tasted, and it too was really good. Have been living here for years and don't know how we missed this place. Mike, our server, was spot on in all of his recommendations. We'll be back.

RzfGFFcJooolmADZx9SsHg.text: Took a colleague for dinner here and had nothing but specials! It was really good, a white fish, can't remember the name over savory crepes.  Delicious!! The service was fantastic as well.  The server was knowledgeable about the menu and its components, which is always a good thing.  My colleague was pregnant and couldn't have several items, but he explained everything thoroughly which made her comfortable, which ultimately made me comfortable as well. All in all - Four Stars.  I am returning next week for Queen's feast where I will more than likely eat off the regular menu.
